jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Sales Assistant - BWS Franklin (143294)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
Are you passionate about customers and being part of a winning team?
Are you motivated, eager to succeed, and love working with people?
Are you looking for a company that offers satisfying career paths filled with challenges, variety, fun and limitless opportunity?
If so, BWS might be the right fit for you!
BWS is the leading convenience drinks brand with over 1200 stores nationally. We pride ourselves on providing exceptional customer service to our customers and are passionate about the products that we sell.
As BWS is part of Australia’s largest retailer, joining BWS also allows you opportunity to explore career paths across the Woolworths Limited business.
Sales Assistant - BWS Franklin
Woolworths Liquor Group develops and offers our customers an exciting and ever-growing portfolio of Exclusive Brands. We are much more than a liquor store though, we are part of Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, and have the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands. With financial services and award-winning multi-channel initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian retail.
Key responsibilities include:
Our Sales Assistants provide excellent customer service and in turn achieve maximum sales. The successful candidate for this role will be working within a dynamic team environment and will enjoy the buzz of retailing whilst adhering to store policies and procedures, as well as assisting in the merchandising of the store in keeping with the company image.
We have a position available at our new store at Franklin. It is a casual position with the successful team member required to be available to work nights and weekends.
In order to be successful for this position you will be able to meet the following selection criteria:
• A passion for customer service
• Previous experience in a customer service role
• Ability to work cooperatively as part of a team
• Excellent verbal communication skills
• Excellent presentation
• The ability to work within a dynamic and physical retail environment
• Available to work across a 7 day working week, including nights and weekends
• Heavy and repetitive lifting is a requirement of this position
At BWS, safety is a core value - Destination Zero is our mission of zero harm to our people, environment and community
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Bakery Team Member - Woolworths Schofields Town Centre (143262)
jobs_requirement:
Fresh Food Bakery Team Member | Woolworths
Do you have a passion for retail and customer service? Make a fresh career choice with us today!
• Become a part of the Fresh Food Team
• Connect and give back to your community
• Unlimited career opportunities
About Us
At Woolworths, spreading the joy of food to our customers is the reason we do what we do. We live it, we breathe it.
Woolworths offers real opportunities for career development, for those who love food, leading developing large teams and putting a smile on a customer’s face.
Woolworths ‘Fresh Food’ Team Members work across all departments within the Store as part of productive and customer service focused team, striving to give our customers the best experience each time they visit. So if you’re someone who leads by example and strives to be better every day, then we would love to hear from you.
As a Woolworths ‘Fresh Food’ Team Member you will be committed to making our customer experiences enjoyable every time through working well in a great team, providing great customer service and always looking at ways to better our customer experience within the Store.
• Structured learning and development environment
• Opportunity to develop and enhance customer service skills
• Provide customers with engaging, efficient, friendly and knowledgeable service
• This is a part time role for 12 hours per week and the availabilities required are 5am till 10am over the 7 days
About You
Have you got the right ingredients to be successful? The Fresh Food People share a love of customers, team and food. From ensuring our customers are top of mind each and every day, through to driving fresh idea’s to continually improve what we do, you’ll constantly strive to be the best, delivering a world class customer experience.
As a Woolworths ‘Fresh Food’ Team Member you will work in a fast paced, team environment, where you will assist in the preparation and production of quality products. Your positive attitude and strong initiative will allow you to communicate with customers and team to ensure they are served in a friendly and efficient manner.
• Ability to work flexible retail hours
• Perform repetitive lifting (sometimes heavy)
• Excited about being able to work on a checkout to serve customers at the end of their shopping experience during peak trading times
• Abide by company policies and procedures at all times including standard of dress

jobs_requirement:
Butcher | Woolworths
Looking to enhance your career? Continue your journey with Woolworths!
• Become a part of the Fresh Food Team
• Connect and give back to your community
• Market competitive enterprise agreement wages and team member benefits
About Us
At Woolworths, spreading the joy of food to our customers is the reason we do what we do. We live it, we breathe it.
Woolworths offers real opportunities for career development, for those who love food, leading developing large teams and putting a smile on a customer’s face.
So if you’re someone who leads by example and strives to be better every day, then we would love to hear from you.
As a Butcher you will prepare and deliver the products that drive our customers into store each and every week as well as provide the best experience to buy Meat within the local area for local customers. We will provide:

• Structured learning and development environment

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Apprentice Baker - Woolworths Colac (143208)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
Woolworths is proud to be Aussie, through and through. It's why 96% of our fresh fruit & veg comes from our very own backyard and it's also the reason why 100% of our fresh meat comes from Australian farms and nowhere else. Welcome to Australia's Fresh Food People!
We are much more than a supermarket though, we are part of Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, and have the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands. With recent expansion into home improvement, financial services and award-winning multi-channel initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian retail.
Woolworths Supermarkets are seeking motivated, enthusiastic and ambitious people who are keen to be trained by a professional team to become Apprentices within our Colac Woolworths Bakery Department.
This is a Full Time position where your will be required to work early mornings and weekends.
Key responsibilities include:
• Ensuring customers are served in a friendly efficient manner
• Assisting in the preparation and production of quality bakery products to company specified guidelines and time frames
• Attending training courses by nominated training provider(s) / trade school(s)
• Maintaining a high standard of housekeeping within the Bakery Department
• Abide by company policies and procedures in relation to Occupational Health and Safety (OH&S) and Food Safety to ensure a safe working environment for customers, staff and contractors
To be considered for this role you need to be able to meet the following selection criteria:
• Communicate with customers and staff
• Work in a fast-paced team environment
• Portray a positive attitude and show initiative
• Ability to be available for work across the 7 days which may include evening work and some public holidays (starting time can be as early as 3am)
• Ensure that attendance of training courses conducted by nominated training provider(s) meets requirements for completion
• Complete duties as directed by your manager/supervisor
• Commitment to complete apprenticeship in designated timeframe
• Abide by company policies and procedures at all times, including company dress standards
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Assistant Buyer (143189)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
BIG W is a modern, Australian Discount Department Store. WIth a heritage dating back to 1964 and now 186 stores across Australia we are proud of of our 52 year history. We are all about offering our customers choice, by designing products in-house that our customers want but by also offering them national and international brands that they know and trust.
What we're like
One of the most critical elements to our success is our people, having an empowered and high performing team of people that love what they do. BIG W people are passionate, humble and relentlessly curious about all things retail. Everything we do is to provide our customers with warm service and great value products and services.
Role Purpose
Reporting in to a Buyer and buying a small part of their range, at the best cost/deal, this exciting role exists to price the range to maximise sales, profit and customer satisfaction and optimise inventory.
Main Accountabilities
• Conduct research in order to gain a thorough understanding of the target markets and external market drivers (including talking to suppliers, monitoring exchange rate, economic forces & competitors)
• Build range, pricing and channel plan in line with option plan, using insights and aligned to BIG W strategies
• Buy the range in line with option plan and OTB and on the critical path schedule
• Own supplier relationships and optimise supplier portfolio in category, joint business planning and negotiate trading terms with suppliers, ensuring the financial targets are met, partnering with BIGW Asia to maximise own brand offer within category.
• Partner with Graphic Design Team on Own Brand product packaging design
• Identify commercial promotional events and present to marketing (including ROI) so Marketing can establish best marketing campaign activity, ensuring promotions are appropriate creatively as well as commercial
• Work closely with Marketing, Planning and Stores on the execution of promotions and events
• Work closely with Planograms to optimise visual presentation of range
• Analyse in-season and post-season performance. Remain very responsive to sales opportunities to move stock. Use pricing and markdowns deliver on strategy
Core Career Experiences and Behaviours
Experience in a retail buying team, successfully supporting a sizeable category in terms of $ and options.
Previous experience trading a small category desirable.
Commercial Acumen - Delivers results through others and thinks ahead. Strong analytical thinking with the ability to interpret results, analyse and plan for the future
Stakeholder management - Is able to influence and positively engage with others (i.e. Design, Marketing, Quality and Supply Chain)
Superior commercial negotiation and influencing skills
Humility, curiosity, service and teamwork

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Customer Assistant - Dan Murphy's Frankston (143175)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
Are you passionate about wine, beer and spirits and delivering world-class customer experience? If so, Dan Murphy's may be the right fit for you!
At Dan Murphy's our philosophy is simple: to provide our customers the largest range of wine, beer and spirits from both Australia and the rest of the world at prices that are guaranteed to be lower than those of any other liquor retailer.
Dan Murphy's is a leading liquor retailer and part of Australia's largest retail group, Woolworths Limited. Alongside Dan Murphy's, Woolworths Limited includes some of the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands in Australia. With recent expansion into financial services and award-winning multi option retailing initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian Retail.
As a Customer Assistant, you deliver inspirational customer service throughout our store. You play a critical role as the first and last point of contact for our customers. You sell our brand with passion and enthusiasm, and provide an exceptional experience to each customer every time they visit our stores.
The suitable candidate will be offered a Part-Time position.
To be considered for this role must have availability across the following hours:
Monday - Wednesday 14:00 - 20:00
Thursday - Saturday 13:00 - 21:00
Key responsibilities include:
• Build relationships by sharing stories, getting to know our customers' needs and recommending products they feel good about
• Share your passion for our Pinnacle Liquor Brands and generate excitement about new products and promotions
• Use merchandising flair to create a visually appealing in store theatre
• Contribute to Dan Murphy's amazing team spirit
To be considered for this role you need to be able to meet the following selection criteria:
• Confidence to interact and have fun with others;
• Energy and edge and a love for the pace and changing landscape that retail offers;
• Understanding and ability to deliver world-class customer service;
• A want to sell with outstanding communication skills;
• Desire to challenge the status quo and demonstrate creativity in solving problems;
• Ability to work both independently and within a team
• Willingness to learn and implement product knowledge and selling techniques.
We will offer you:
• Reward for developing your product knowledge and selling capability
• Added benefits - including staff discount, corporate health care options, and much more.
• Training and education - we pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and offer a diverse range of learning and development experiences
• An exciting career - as our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Customer Service Team Member - Hardings Dandenong (143171)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
Home Timber & Hardware Group is the home of quality hardware and expert advice, proudly servicing builders, tradies and home renovators across the nation under the main retail brands – Home Timber & Hardware and Thrifty-Link Hardware. Our vision is to grow and strengthen our business by investing in our people and developing strong partnerships with our customers and our vendors.
HARDINGS HARDWARE - Dandenong
Built upon a foundation of old school-values since opening for business in 1958, Hardings Hardware is the No. 1 builder's choice for all plumbing, building and renovation supplies. Our commitment to stocking the 'Best Brands at the Lowest Prices' is matched by the Hardings family commitment to providing exemplary customer service and product advice in everything we do.
We pride ourselves in hiring the best people and stocking the best products to ensure the best results for each and every project. We are current with modern trends and materials and well versed in our understanding of all the projects we supply, including many environmentally friendly products.
Hardings Hardware are excited to have a new Customer Service - Sales team member join their family.
The suitable candidate will be offered a Full-Time position.
To be considered for this role must have availability to work across the following hours:
Monday - Friday 08:00 - 17:00
What is the job?
An entry-level support position assisting the sales team finalise their orders
Engaging with builders, plumbers, etc., regarding their orders, both on the phone and via email
Assist the wider sales team placing, sending and managing orders and creating solutions to day-to-day issues
Process orders by collating and organising delivery for warehouse dispatch
Ensure a terrific customer experience, including resolving customer complaints
Understand the products and business to best support the customers and sales team
What do you need?
Demonstrated experience providing outstanding customer engagement
Ability to engage with a variety of personalities
Strong verbal communication skills, including conflict resolution
Be able to think outside the square to solve problems and create answers
Strong computer skills and ability to quickly learn new systems
Experience within the building industry is preferred, however not essential
What's in it for me?
Great family, team environment
Full time, Monday to Friday employment, (8am to 5pm)
Terrific benefits and discounts on things like your grocery shopping, liquor retail, petrol and general merchandise stores
A supportive leader and a chance to be part of Australia's most respected building and plumbing supplier brands
Apply today!
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will support then we want to hear from you!
www.homehardware.com.au

jobs_requirement:

• Demonstrate written and verbal communication skills
• Abide by company policies and procedures at all times including standard of dress

jobs_requirement:
About Us
Are you passionate about wine, beer and spirits and delivering world-class customer experience? If so, Dan Murphy's may be the right fit for you!
At Dan Murphy's our philosophy is simple: to provide our customers the largest range of wine, beer and spirits from both Australia and the rest of the world at prices that are guaranteed to be lower than those of any other liquor retailer.
Dan Murphy's is a leading liquor retailer and part of Australia's largest retail group, Woolworth's Limited. Alongside Dan Murphy's, Woolworths Limited includes some of the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands in Australia. With recent expansion into home improvement, financial services and award-winning multi option retailing initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian Retail.
As a Customer Assistant, you deliver inspirational customer service throughout our store. You play a critical role as the first and last point of contact for our customers. You sell our brand with passion and enthusiasm, and provide an exceptional experience to each customer every time they visit our stores.
The suitable candidate will be offered a Part Time position.
To be considered for this role must have availability to Monday - Sunday 08:00 - 21:00, public holidays, Christmas and Easter availability is required.
Key responsibilities include:
• Build relationships by sharing stories, getting to know our customers' needs and recommending products they feel good about
• Share your passion for our Pinnacle Liquor Brands and generate excitement about new products and promotions
• Use merchandising flair to create a visually appealing in store theatre
• Contribute to Dan Murphy's amazing team spirit
This role is based at Parkale and reports to the Store Manager.

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Executive Assistant (142830)
jobs_requirement:
About BIG W:
For generations BIG W has been the trusted backstop of Australian households - we have clothed Australian families, furnished Australian homes and filled Australian toy boxes for more than 50 years. We opened our first store on the outskirts of Newcastle in New South Wales in 1964 and have 186 stores operating across Australia today. BIG W is proud to provide Australian shoppers with a broad range of quality general merchandise products at low prices. From women's, men's and children's clothing to homewares, electronics, toys and books, BIG W is a popular one-stop-shop for customers across the country.
What we're like:
BIG W's best and most valued asset is its staff. We believe one of the most vital elements of driving success is our people and empowering our workforce to meet their goals and extend their skills is a big part of our business. BIG W people are dynamic, creative, passionate, humble and relentless in their pursuit of a better customer experience. BIG W is a business bursting with potential. We welcome ideas and encourage new ways of thinking to ensure we are delivering the very best shopping experience for our customers.
The role:
This exciting role supports 2 of our energetic and dynamic senior leaders - General Manager of Buying and General Manager of Creative. You will provide full diary management, correspondence management, travel coordination, expenses and other ad hoc administrative support.
To be successful in this role you must have demonstrable, prior experience in an assistant role, ideally within a product/consumer goods company, self starter attitude, fast dynamic style of working and advanced computer skills.
Key responsibilities include:
Provide administrative support to two General Managers including document preparation, diary management, meeting coordination and general administrative duties
Forward thinking/planning of travel across calendars and organisation of travel in accordance with company guidelines and procedures.
Stationary ordering, mail sorting and general administrative tasks as required
To process incoming and outgoing mail and e-mails and either respond where appropriate and / or pass on where or to the appropriate areas of the business.
Coordinate meetings/ conferences/ telephone and video conference calls
Produce, update and distribute reports as requested by the CEO.
You will have:
Previous experience as a corporate Personal Assistant to a senior leader or an equivalent role, ideally within a product or consumer goods organisation
High level of integrity/confidentiality
Ability to multi task and be flexible with priority of work
Intermediate MS Office Suite applications and Google Documents
Commercial judgement / Business Acumen
Polished communication skills (written and verbal)
Diplomacy and composure
Exceptional organisational skills
Sound like your next opportunity? Apply now or head along to www.wowcareers.com.au to discover more!

jobs_requirement:

As a wholly owned subsidiary of Australia’s biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, we understand that people are important to the success of our business. Our aim is to employ and train the best technicians in Australia.

Reporting to the Operations Support Centre Manager, the Team Leader will be a knowledgeable, courteous, efficient, and customer-centric point of contact for our customer-base, while providing daily leadership of the team and oversight of the workflow, quality and quantity of output delivered.

Furthermore, as a Team Leader you will offer support, coaching and mentoring to the front line staff while helping to create a culture that drives high-performance.

Previous Customer Service experience and a genuine passion for service excellence in a supervisory capacity
Excellent telephone manner with strong verbal communication skills
The ability to plan and organise work for your team and provide coaching support for development
Strong written communication skills
Attention to detail
Fantastic analytical problem solving skills
It is not essential but desirable that the successful candidate has:
Familiarity and use of a maintenance management system ie; Pronto or similar.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
A career with Retail FM will push you and challenge you, providing growth opportunities and the prospects to advance your career. You will have exposure to highly skilled people and access to a host of staff benefits including:
An attractive remuneration package
Ongoing training and development opportunities

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Chilled Foods Assistant - Part Time - Meadowlands, Auckland (139945)
jobs_requirement:
Working for Countdown isn't just about in-store opportunities. We're at the cutting edge of retail innovation, and this is supported by a reputable Manufacturing, Logistics and Corporate division including Construction, Property Management, Legal, IT, Finance, HR, Customer Service, Buying and Marketing.
Countdown is a great New Zealand Company providing our customers with quality, range and value. We are built on a passion for retail, dedication and a commitment to making our customers experience more enjoyable every time.
Countdown Supermarkets are seeking a motivated, enthusiastic and energetic person to join our Chilled Foods Team. The hours for this role are Thursday Friday Saturday & Sunday hrs 2100 - 03.30 am.
Key responsibilities include:
• Assisting in the preparation and production of products to company specified guidelines and time frames
• Filling and maintaining the presentation of stock
• Ensuring customers are served in a friendly and efficient manner
• Working cooperatively in a team environment
• Abiding by company policies and procedures in relation to Occupational Health and Safety (OH&S) and Food Safety to ensure a safe working environment for customers, staff and contractors
To be considered for this role you need to be able to meet the following selection criteria
• Ability to be available to work a flexible roster which may include evenings and late nights across the 7 days of the week and which may also include some public holidays
• Communicate effectively with customers and staff
• Work in a fast-paced team environment
• Perform repetitive lifting (sometimes heavy)
• Portray a positive attitude
• Demonstrate written and verbal communication skills
• Abide by company policies and procedures at all times including standard of dress
At Countdown, safety is a core value - countdown to zero is our mission of zero harm to our people, environment and community.
This is an entry level role with great opportunities to advance for the right candidate - Make a Fresh Career Choice today.
For more information about Countdown careers, visit http://www.countdown.co.nz/about-us/careers

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Order Selector - Brisbane Liquor Distribution Centre Stapylton (142975)
jobs_requirement:
Select yourself a new career today!
Click here to view a short video on life as an Order Selector at Woolworths.
To view the job description Click here.
About Us
Quality and freshness doesn’t come easy, which is why we have a fantastic group of people working around the clock at Woolworths Distribution Centres to tackle the mind boggling logistical challenge of coordinating supplies from the farm-gate to supermarket shelves across the state.
Our Distribution Centres are also a critical control point in checking the quality of fresh food and placing it in the optimal conditions to protect its flavour, freshness and texture. Alongside the top service we provide to our supermarkets we also have super performance in our Distribution Network which store stock for many of our other brands such as BWS, Dan Murphy’s, Big W, Masters Home Improvement to mention just a few.
Woolworths Limited is one of Australia's largest retailers with our Logistics Division employing more than 8000 people across a national network of transport and distribution centre operations, moving millions of cartons each day. Our Brisbane Liquor Distribution Centre (BLDC) boasts a large fast-paced operation distributing stock to our network of stores throughout Queensland and New South Wales. The BLDC is located off the M1 near Yatala.
BLDC is currently seeking applications for casual employment; you will need to have flexible availability across Monday to Sunday - 5am to 10pm
The role of an order selector plays an integral role in ensuring that the right stock gets to the right store at the right time for our customers, Logistics is constantly changing to meet business demands. The position requires a strong sense of team work to ensure that the goods are dispatched in a timely manner.
Key responsibilities include:
Picking orders accurately and in a timely manner
Assembling and packaging stock appropriately for dispatch
Operating industrial equipment in accordance to Occupational Health and Safety requirements
Housekeeping
Despatch and receiving as required by operation and business needs
You will have:
A passion for providing the best customer service experience
Ability to work under pressure to meet replenishment targets
Capacity to work in a physically demanding role
Proficient written and verbal communication
Abide by company policies and procedures
Ability to be able to work a flexible roster
Comply with Occupational Health and Safety policies and procedures
As an order selector, you will enjoy a safe and friendly working environment, attractive wages and the opportunity to develop both personally and professionally in an organisation that truly values its employees
Part of creating a safe working environment, the BLDC operates under a zero tolerance Drug & Alcohol Policy for all those on site. Employees are subject to possible random testing, and applicants to this role can expect to undergo tests as part of the recruitment process, in addition to a full physical.
At Woolworths, safety is a core value - Destination Zero is our mission of zero harm to our people, environment and community.

jobs_requirement:
About BIG W
BIG W is a modern, Australian Discount Department Store. WIth a heritage dating back to 1964 and now 186 stores across Australia we are proud of of our 52 year history. We are all about offering our customers choice, by designing products in-house that our customers want but by also offering them national and international brands that they know and trust.
What we’re like
One of the most critical elements to our success is our people, having an empowered and high performing team of people that love what they do. BIG W people are passionate, humble and relentlessly curious about all things retail. Everything we do is to provide our customers with warm service and great value products and services.
Key role within our finance team
Clear autonomy and accountability
Partner with our online team
In this role, you will
• Partner with the Online team to provide commercial insights that deliver improved financial performance
• Collaborate with stakeholders to gain an understanding of the business and the key drivers of performance
• Assist in preparing accurate monthly, weekly and quarterly forecasts and provide constructive challenges

• Assist in finalising month end and other reporting by financial control

About you
• Previous commercial experience and CA/CPA qualified or working towards
• Experience in a retail environment is highly desirable
• Strong systems skills with SAP, TM1 and MS Excel, including financial modelling experience
• Strong communication skills, stakeholder management and relationship building skills
• Can handle pressure and manage expectations whilst servicing people from across different departments

Dan Murphy's is a leading liquor retailer and part of Australia's largest retail group, Woolworths Limited. Alongside Dan Murphy's, Woolworths Limited includes some of the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands in Australia. With recent expansion into home improvement, financial services and award-winning multi option retailing initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian Retail.
Customer Assistant - Dan Murphy's Carnes Hill
As a Customer Assistant, you deliver inspirational customer service throughout our store. You play a critical role as the first and last point of contact for our customers. You sell our brand with passion and enthusiasm, and provide an exceptional experience to each customer every time they visit our stores.
This is a Casual Position. Availability required Wednesday - Saturday 3:15 pm - 9:15 pm
Key responsibilities include:
• Build relationships by sharing stories, getting to know our customers' needs and recommending products they feel good about
• Share your passion for our Pinnacle Liquor Brands and generate excitement about new products and promotions
• Use merchandising flair to create a visually appealing in store theatre
• Contribute to Dan Murphy's amazing team spirit
To be considered for this role you need to be able to meet the following selection criteria:
• Confidence to interact and have fun with others;
• Energy and edge and a love for the pace and changing landscape that retail offers;
• Understanding and ability to deliver world-class customer service;
• A want to sell with outstanding communication skills;
• Desire to challenge the status quo and demonstrate creativity in solving problems;
• Ability to work both independently and within a team
• Willingness to learn and implement product knowledge and selling techniques.
We will offer you:
• Reward for developing your product knowledge and selling capability

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: National Transport Operations Manager - Nexday - Rydalmere (142817)
jobs_requirement:
National Transport Operations Manager Nexday - Rydalmere
Ready for a challenge? An opportunity to be a part of one of the biggest retail transformations in Australia.
Nexday Logistics in the Endeavour Drinks Group
Lead our 8 transport hub teams and driver engagement
Be part of CHANGE and INNOVATION in customer delivery for our Digital & Direct businesses
Best time to join is now…..
About Us
As a business we’re excited about our future, and we want you to be an influential part of it. Our business is rapidly transforming retail as we know it and we need our best people to drive us forward with passion, precision and ingenuity. Our family of leading brands is well respected and highly visible throughout Australia with each of them commanding a leadership position in their respective category.
Household names Dan Murphys and BWS and our specialist digital and direct to customer businesses: Cellarmasters, Langtons and Winemarket as well as Pinnacle Drinks which manages own and exclusive brands on behalf of the group
Work with a team of industry leaders within Woolworths Ltd
Build on a culture that focuses on customer service, safety, openness and trust
Manage our transport spend across the group to budget outcomes
Ability to continuously improve our transport operations
About You:
WOWpeople are great people. Whether we’re learning new things, seizing the initiative, or winning together our customers are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re the sort of individual who takes accountability and strives to always do the right thing for each other, our communities, our customers, and our business then we ought to connect.
Reporting to the General Manager - Nexday Logistics in the Endeavour Drinks Group this role is responsible for all aspects of the day to day operation of our national network of transport hubs and last mile customer delivery across contracted drivers and carrier partners. Key to success in this role will be the ability to lead the team and drivers to achieve and continually improve. In this position you will build strong working relationships across a broad cross section of peers including contact centres, fulfilment operations, 3PLs, business stakeholders and external clients.
The primary purpose of the role is to ensure that the operation meets our objectives in terms of safety, service, cost and the responsible service of alcohol.
You will:
Come with 5-10 years experience in Logistics or Transport preferably in retail or B2B or B2C delivery networks
Have proven experience coaching and mentoring a team while demonstrating success in leading change and managing performance
Bring strong compliance knowledge in a least one of the following, CoR, RSA, Safety
Have the ability to operate in a complex, fast paced operation where understanding of the detail and capability to work autonomously within a framework are key requirements
Be a strategic thinker and have strong commercial acumen.
We’re social! - connect with us at #WOWcareers through LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram or via www.wowcareers.com.au #LI
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_requirement:
Commercial Finance Manager | The Home of Tradies
Heatherton | Commercial Manager | Diverse and exciting role, managing a variety of stakeholders | Newly created role - make it your own!
Join a market leading national company
Lead, mentor and manage a team of 5-6
Collaborate with stakeholders to implement new initiatives and efficiencies
About Us
Home Timber & Hardware Group is the home of quality hardware and expert advice, proudly servicing builders, tradies and home renovators across the nation under the main retail brands – Home Timber & Hardware, Thrifty-Link Hardware. Our vision is to grow and strengthen our business by investing in our people and developing strong partnerships with our customers and our vendors.
Market leading, national, industry leader
Fantastic opportunity to add value to both the business and your experience
Excellent offices with a great team
About You
Home Timber and Hardware people are great people. Whether we’re learning new things, seizing the initiative, or winning together our customers are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re the sort of individual who takes accountability and strives to always do the right thing for each other, our communities, our customers, and our business then we ought to connect.
Based in Melbourne, our Home Timber Hardware business is currently seeking an experienced Commercial Manager on a permanent basis. The Commercial Manager will have primary responsibility for the analysis, budgeting, forecasting and management reporting functions for the business. The main focus of the role will be to proactively leverage systems to streamline forecasting, KPI and management forecasting.
They will also be the key business partner for assessing, analysing and providing recommendations to improve overall business performance with a focus on EBIT, GP, CODB and sales insights.
This role is based in Heatherton, Melbourne.
In this role, you will:
Provide value add business decision support, information, analysis and insight to the business to drive improved business performance and improved decision making
Perform advanced analysis around performance trends and forecasts, as well as ad hoc projects, to improve business performance and efficiency
Plan, organise and lead the completion of the annual budgeting program and monthly forecasting
Present a robust budget – P & L, Balance sheet and cash flow in a manner to assist decision making and aligns with business strategy.
Management of the group's monthly management reporting and variance analysis to Business Unit Leadership Team, WoW Corporate, WoW Board and JV Board.
Development of KPI, Balance Scorecard, benchmarking and other tools to provide insight and analysis to the business to assist business management and decision making
Monitor the activities and performance of the business to identify changes requiring
Pro-actively seek out new ways to add value to the business by challenging and improving current processes.
To be considered for this role you should have the following:
Postgraduate – CA, CPA, CFA, MBA, ASIA
Excellent knowledge of financial concepts and principles
Commercial Experience
Strong Budgeting, Forecasting and financial analysis experience in a large / corporate business environment
High level of experience in use of Microsoft products particularly Excel
Experience in use of BI tools such as TM1
Knowledge of retail industry drivers
Demonstrated ability to provide leadership to a team during periods of organizational change
Proven ability to manage, supervise and provide leadership to a small team
Ability to work effectively as part of a team in a fast changing environment
Ability to work productively with limited supervision and to work to deadlines.
Demonstrated excellence in written, verbal and interpersonal skills.
Excellent organisation and planning skills in managing a personal workload in a busy environment with conflicting demands
High level of problem solving and analytical ability
Proven ability to exercise sound judgment in complex decision making
We Will Offer You
Attractive Remuneration Package - including base salary, super and incentive scheme.
Many Woolworths employee benefits including staff discount
An exciting career - As our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
Want to connect? Connect with me on LinkedIn (Phillip Neho) We’re also social! - connect with us at #WOWcareers through LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram or via www.wowcareers.com.au
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will support then we want to hear from you!
www.homehardware.com.au

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Customer Experience Manager - Dan Murphy's Brighton (142571)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
Are you passionate about wine, beer and spirits and delivering world-class customer experience? If so, Dan Murphy's may be the right fit for you!
At Dan Murphy's our philosophy is simple: to provide our customers the largest range of wine, beer and spirits from both Australia and the rest of the world at prices that are guaranteed to be lower than those of any other liquor retailer.
Dan Murphy's is a leading liquor retailer and part of Australia's largest retail group, Woolworths Limited. Alongside Dan Murphy's, Woolworths Limited includes some of the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands in Australia. With recent expansion into home improvement, financial services and award-winning multi option retailing initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian Retail.
As a Customer Experience Manager, you collaborate with the store leadership team to manage a Dan Murphy's store. You provide support for team and customers alike, and deliver the overall vision and sales objectives of the business. The Customer Experience Manager is key to ensuring our brand and stories are presented with passion and enthusiasm, and that customers are provided with a world class shopping experience every time they visit our store.
Key responsibilities include:
• Collaborate with the store leadership team to efficiently manage the store
• Lead team in delivery of world class customer experience, incredible product knowledge, effective sales techniques, promotions, events and in-store theatre
• Responsible for the overall product knowledge and selling techniques activities, and coach and motivate the entire team

As part of creating a safe working environment, our Distribution Centres operates under a Drug & Alcohol Policy for all those on site. jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Order Selector - Wodonga Regional Distribution Centre (137299)
jobs_requirement:
Select yourself a new career today!
Click here to view a short video on life as an Order Selector at Woolworths.
To view the job description Click here.
About Us
Quality and freshness doesn’t come easy, which is why we have a fantastic group of people working around the clock at Woolworths Distribution Centres to tackle the mind boggling logistical challenge of coordinating supplies from the farm-gate to supermarket shelves across the state.
Our Distribution Centres are also a critical control point in checking the quality of fresh food and placing it in the optimal conditions to protect its flavour, freshness and texture. Alongside the top service we provide to our supermarkets we also have super performance in our Distribution Network which store stock for many of our other brands such as BWS, Dan Murphy’s, Big W, Masters Home Improvement to mention just a few.
The role of a store person plays an integral role in ensuring that the right stock gets to the right store at the right time for our customers, Logistics is constantly changing to meet business demands. The position requires a strong sense of team work to ensure that the goods are dispatched in a timely manner.
This is a casual position. The successful applicant will need to have a flexible availability across Monday to Sunday.
Key responsibilities include:
• Picking orders accurately and in a timely manner
• Assembling and packaging stock appropriately for dispatch
• Operating industrial equipment in accordance to Occupational Health and Safety requirements
• Housekeeping
• Despatch and receiving as required by operation and business needs
To be considered for this role you need to be able to meet the following selection criteria:
• A passion for providing the best customer service experience
• Ability to work under pressure to meet replenishment targets
• Capacity to work in a physically demanding role
• Proficient written and verbal communication
• Abide by company policies and procedures
• Ability to be able to work a flexible roster
• Comply with Occupational Health and Safety policies and procedures
At Woolworths, safety is a core value - Destination Zero is our mission of zero harm to our people, environment and community.

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Team Manager - Surry HIlls (121376)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
Are you passionate about wine, beer and spirits and delivering world-class customer experience? If so, Dan Murphy's may be the right fit for you!
At Dan Murphy's our philosophy is simple: to provide our customers the largest range of wine, beer and spirits from both Australia and the rest of the world at prices that are guaranteed to be lower than those of any other liquor retailer.
Dan Murphy's is a leading liquor retailer and part of Australia's largest retail group, Woolworths Limited. Alongside Dan Murphy's, Woolworths Limited includes some of the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands in Australia. With recent expansion into home improvement, financial services and award-winning multi option retailing initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian Retail.
Team Manager - Surry Hills
Want to work for one of Australia’s most recognisable brands in an award winning digital business?
Are you passionate about delivering exceptional customer experience in a Sales through Service culture?
Do you have a proven ability to build and develop high performing teams?
Dan Murphy’s online has been on a phenomenal growth trajectory over the last three years.
In April 2013 we undertook a huge project to bring an outsourced contact centre in-house.
Over the past 12 months the team has gone from strength to strength and achieved some amazing results.
We are now looking for a seriously talented Team Manager to develop our teams and drive continuous improvement to maximise customer experience and outcomes.
Some exciting key focus areas over the next 12 months will be; supporting new digital projects, driving sales and optimising operational efficiencies and of course continuous improvement of our effectiveness when delivering an exceptional customer proposition .
This is a great opportunity to join a passionate team and make your name with one of Australia’s largest employers.
The Role:
Ensure Dan Murphy Online KPIs/SLAs are met through day to day management of team
Coach & develop team to high performance standards
Report on Sales & Service centre operational performance
Feed customer insights back into business and provide recommendations
Manage & meet sales up sell budget
Conduct Performance Reviews
Maximise customer contact outcomes
QA reviews
Manage staff adherence, minimise staff attrition
Manage Customer escalations
Be part of our continuous improvement culture and a change advocate for new customer experience strategies
Maximise resource availability
Your Skills:
2 years Team Management experience of up to 15 direct reports
Proficient experience with telephony management and workflow systems
Proven track record in coaching, mentoring and developing high performing teams
Strong communication skills
Ability to negotiate positive business outcomes
Goal orientated
Positive high energy person
Adaptable and able to react to changing needs of a dynamic business
Ruthless prioritiser
Calm and focused under pressure
Confident and self assured
Strong analytical & statistical skills
Proven conflict resolution skills
Team player
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Major Incident Manager (142411)
jobs_requirement:
About The Role:
As a Major Incident Manager you will raise, control and manage the resolution major incidents for the IT division. To facilitate the fastest possible response to major incidents, the MIMs are rostered on site at Norwest, Bella Vista on a 24X7 basis. You will be responsible for escalating Major Incidents to appropriate levels of management if they are not resolved within expected timeframes, mobilise and coordinate Woolworths IT and Service provider and IT staff and management to resolve major incidents.
What You'll Do:
Raise, control and manage the resolution major incidents.
Facilitate the fastest possible response to major incidents, the MIMs are rostered on site at Norwest on a 24X7 basis
Escalates Major Incidents to appropriate levels of management if they are not resolved within expected timeframe
Mobilise and coordinate Woolworths IT and Service provider IT staff and management to resolve major incidents
Provide timely, accurate and quality communication status and service reporting of IT service incidents and impacts to the business
Ensure that the work logs of all Severity 1 Incidents are updated with key progress items, activities and actions
Liaise with the all providers, stakeholders and information consumers to ensure that the Major incident management process is managed and conduct meets requirements
Support Post-Incident review and assessment, documentation preparation and Problem Management
Provide timely and accurate daily and weekly service reporting to key stakeholders
What You'll Need to Succeed:
Deep demonstrable knowledge of Incident, Problem Management processes
Demonstrated excellent communication skills - verbal, written, electronic
Proficient in the use of PC, Chromebook, iPhone/Android, iPad/tablet technologies and WoW Incident-oriented applications (CA-SDM, OpDash, MessageNet etc)
High degree of proficiency in office automation tools - MS and Google applications
Excellent attention to detail, quality and control
Be an analytical thinker with the ability to define and present information (e.g. Business Comms, RfT reports, PIRs)
Excellent interpersonal skills including listening, building rapport and an awareness of internal and external issues
Sound judgment and ability assess multiple conflicting and occasionally ambiguous information sources to reach correct
Knowledge of conclusions and courses of action for Incident Management conduct and escalation
Desirable: Experience in Retail Management
What we can offer you:
An attractive remuneration package - including base salary, super and annual bonus
Added benefits - Including staff discounts, flexibility to work from different sites, healthcare, social club and much more (Site dependent)
Tech options - Woolworths are the largest employer of Google Apps in Australia, are early adopters of Agile and have BYOD options too
Work variety - The opportunity to work on multiple brands and sizeable projects
Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and give you the opportunity to be innovative
An exciting career - As our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Champagne Product Expert - Dan Murphy's Brighton (138486)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
Are you passionate about wine, beer and spirits and delivering world-class customer experience? If so, Dan Murphy's may be the right fit for you!
At Dan Murphy's our philosophy is simple: to provide our customers the largest range of wine, beer and spirits from both Australia and the rest of the world at prices that are guaranteed to be lower than those of any other liquor retailer.
Dan Murphy's is a leading liquor retailer and part of Australia's largest retail group, Woolworths Limited. Alongside Dan Murphy's, Woolworths Limited includes some of the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands in Australia. With recent expansion into home improvement, financial services and award-winning multi option retailing initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian Retail.
As a Product Expert, you deliver inspirational customer service throughout our store. You play a critical role as the first and last point of contact for our customers. You have a high level of knowledge across all liquor product categories however, will have vast experience with Champagnes. You sell our brand with passion and enthusiasm, and provide an exceptional experience to each customer every time they visit our stores.
Key responsibilities include:
• Enhance the customer's shopping experience and make them feel valued to make them want to return to relive the experience
• Build relationships by sharing stories, getting to know our customers' needs and recommending products they feel good about
• Share your product knowledge with team and customers through in-store tasting sessions, master classes, and other exciting events
• Share your passion for our Pinnacle Liquor Brands and generate excitement about new products and promotions
• Use merchandising flair to create a visually appealing in store theatre
• Contribute to Dan Murphy's amazing team spirit
To be considered for this role you need to be able to meet the following selection criteria:
• Understanding and ability to deliver world-class customer service;
• High level of product knowledge across various liquor categories;
• Charisma to engage others through exceptional communication and storytelling;
• Energy and edge and a love for the pace and changing landscape that retail offers;
• A demonstrated ability to sell and meet targets;
• Desire to challenge the status quo and demonstrate creativity in solving problems;
• Ability to work both independently and within a team
We will offer you:
• Attractive remuneration with added benefits - including staff discount, corporate health care options, and much more.
• Training and education - we pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and offer a diverse range of learning and development experiences
• An exciting career - as our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_requirement:
Store Management | Fuel
Looking to ignite your career? Fuel your future with us!
• Dynamic, market leading operation
• Lead the innovation and customer focus to change the face of Australian retail
• Immerse yourself within a culture that offers real opportunities for career development
There are currently opportunities for Store Manager and Assistant Store Manager positions within the Port Headland Store.
About Us
Operating since 1996, Woolworths Fuel is growing fast offering pay point and convenience sites to our customers nationally. We are much more than a Fuel retailer though, we are part of Woolworths Limited which is made up of the most recognisable and trusted brands in retailing.
Our expertise stretches across food, liquor, fuel, general merchandise, financial services and home improvement and we're building on that foundation to diversify into new areas.
As a part of our Store Management team, you will be dedicated to making your store shine. You will be accountable for maximising sales, profit and growth each and every week!
• Flexibility and Autonomy
• Maximise sales, profitability and opportunity for growth
• Ensure the health and safety of all store associates and customers
About You
Woolworths people are great people. Whether we’re learning new things, seizing the initiative, or winning together our customers are at the heart of everything we do.
If you’re the sort of individual who takes accountability and strives to always do the right thing for each other, our communities, our customers, and our business then we ought to connect.
As a part of our Store Management Team, your positive attitude and a desire to go above and beyond will see you thrive in our fast paced retail environment.
Your passion for customer service will enhance their overall experience. Your exceptional multi-tasking abilities and observation skills will enable you to be responsible for the safety and security of the site.
You will lead your team to deliver exceptional customer service, providing training and development of team members in sales, service and safety.
• Strong financial management skills

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Refrigeration Service Technician ( HVAC+R Mechanics) - Northern Beaches (127238)
jobs_requirement:
Join some of the most capable, hard-working and technically skilled people in the refrigeration and air-conditioning industry to achieve success and progress the business with energy and enthusiasm.
We are a new team of top performers who are driven by not just meeting our own ambitious goals, but by exceeding them. We are proud to be working for an organisation that is committed to continuous improvement, a culture of accountability, a winner’s intensity and a strong service ethic.
Does this sound like the kind of place where you will thrive in?
About us:
Retail FM is one of the largest providers of Refrigeration and Air Conditioning services in Australia. We are continuing to grow by providing outstanding engineering and maintenance solutions to our selected customers across the nation. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, we understand that people are important to the success of our business
About the role:
We are currently seeking an experienced Service Technician - NSW on a permanent basis. Reporting to the Service Supervisor your primary responsibility is to achieve productivity levels as per agreed customer-generated reactive calls to be closed per day and to complete allocated planned maintenance activities (air conditioning and pre-summer).
In this role, you will:
Proactively look for potential sources of refrigerant gas leaks in order to reduce refrigerant usage
Reduce average reactive call volume per store/month below agreed target
Control and reduce costs (labour, materials, sub contractors) against store budget
Ensure refrigeration case uptime to maximise sales for customer
Achieve service response times as per business rules
Achieve first time fix targets
Meet energy saving targets as agreed with key stakeholders
Maintain and update Asset registers
To be considered for this role you should have the following:
Trade qualification – minimum of Certificate III in Refrigeration and Air Conditioning or equivalent
Restricted Electrical Workers License (where required by state legislation)
Current, valid ArcTick Refrigerant Handling Licence
Current, valid Motor Vehicle Drivers Licence
A minimum of two (2) years’ post apprenticeship experience in a similar role within the commercial refrigeration service and installation industry, preferably with commercial supermarket experience
Strong technical and operational skills with a sound understanding of commercial / supermarkets refrigeration and air conditioning systems and equipment
Well developed verbal and written communication skills
Strong interpersonal and customer service skills
High attention to detail
Effective time management and organisational skills
Ability to work autonomously
Ability to work under pressure to set deadlines without compromise to quality or service
What we can offer you:
Attractive Remuneration Package - including base salary, super and incentive scheme.
Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential.
An exciting career - As our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
Are you an industry specialist looking for your next career move?
Why not make it with the newest member to the Woolworths Limited family, Retail FM.

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Refrigeration Technician - Installations (125875)
jobs_requirement:
Join some of the most capable, hard-working and technically skilled people in the refrigeration and air-conditioning industry to achieve success and progress the business with energy and enthusiasm.
We are a new team of top performers who are driven by not just meeting our own ambitious goals, but by exceeding them. We are proud to be working for an organisation that is committed to continuous improvement, a culture of accountability, a winner’s intensity and a strong service ethic.

Retail FM is one of the largest providers of Refrigeration and Air Conditioning services in Australia. We are continuing to grow by providing outstanding engineering and maintenance solutions to our selected customers across the nation. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, we understand that people are important to the success of our business
ABOUT THE ROLE
Installation Technicians are responsible for the day to day installations of commercial refrigeration equipment. This role is based in Sydney but will require travel across NSW and sometimes interstate.
To be successful in this position, it is essential that you have:
Demonstrated experience in installations of a broad range of commercial refrigeration systems. Supermarket and/ or retail experience advantageous
Trade qualification - Certificate III in Refrigeration and Air Conditioning. Further tertiary qualifications highly regarded
A current and valid Australian Driving Licence
A current and valid ArcTick Refrigerant Handling Licence
A strong customer and team Focus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Attention to detail and focus on safety and quality
Solid troubleshooting and problem solving skills
The ability to prioritise competing tasks and work under pressure without direct supervision
Please note: Candidates with a strong trade assistant background are encouraged to apply.
What we can offer you:
A financially sound and stable long term career in the Refrigeration and HVAC Service Industry
Attractive and Competitive Remuneration Package that also supports a work life balance
Annual incentive plan up to 10% of base salary
Your choice of a fully maintained vehicle or a vehicle allowance
Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential
An exciting career - As our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people!
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you! Click on the Apply button or email your resume to recruitment@retailfm.com.au.

jobs_requirement:
Are you the pick of the crop? Join the fresh food people in this critical success role.
Dynamic, market leading organisation
Significant leadership role providing coaching and development
Above market remuneration + benefits
About Us
Woolworths is proud to be Aussie, through and through. It's why 96% of our fresh fruit & veg comes from our very own backyard and it's also the reason why 100% of our fresh meat comes from Australian farms and nowhere else. Welcome to Australia's Fresh Food People!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Network Planner (Supply Chain) (140270)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
As Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, has the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands. With recent expansion into home improvement, financial services and award-winning multi-channel initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian retail.
Network Planner - Supply Chain
A Career with Woolworths Supply Chain can take you places
Dynamic, market leading organisation
Critical role within Replenishment team - based in Bella Vista
Above market remuneration + benefits
About Us
Supply Chain is at the heart of Woolworths. It’s our job to make sure the 28 million customers we serve each week can get the products they want – when, where and how they want them.
The Network Planner optimises the supply chain range position and use of inventory within the Woolworths Food and Liquor distribution network and reduce operational costs.
Through analysing range opportunities and cost benefits, and the expert manipulation of ordering system parameters; the Network Planner is able to ensure efficient network utilisation without breaching constraints and ensure the best product availability considering all factors influencing demand.
The Network Planner is responsible for ensuring the optimal configuration of replenishment systems; to deliver optimal agreed inventory, superior availability and product flow strategies.
About You:
Writes, speaks, and presents clearly and succinctly across a variety of communication settings by translating and articulating technical concepts to non-technical groups
Strong relationship building skills - an influencer with facilitation and negotiation skills with the ability to build trust and challenge stakeholders to deliver efficiency and performance improvement
Demonstrated experience in supply chain planning with a focus on network modelling and inventory management
Ability to properly package numerical findings and insights to be easily understood by a variety of business stakeholders
Superior MS Office (especially Excel), reporting and ERP system use
Key Responsibilities:
Commercial Planning - Align with commercial teams as to individual category quotas and manage expectations regarding network constraints and network capacity
Logistics and Range Planning - Interface with logistics teams to develop a future view of product ranging capabilities including DC growth and layout changes
Commercial Engagement - Act as a subject matter expert to provide understanding product attributes and impacts on network ranging constraints
Range Management - Develop clear ranging rules and expectations for Product Lifecycle Management including expectations regarding the phasing-in and out of products e.g. timelines for product clearance, advocate replenishment data requirements
Relationship Management - Build collaborative working relationships with DC operations and commercial teams - supporting replenishment and business objective with relationships built upon trust and understanding of roles and expectations
What we offer
Attractive remuneration package and added benefits
An exciting career - as our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
The chance to collaborate and engage with multiple stakeholders
Want to connect? Connect with me on LinkedIn Dean Willett. We’re also social! - connect with us at #WOWcareers through LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram or via www.wowcareers.com.au #LI
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_requirement:

Exciting opportunity to be a part of something unique
Work with a team of industry leaders
Fast paced and dynamic environment
About Us
Woolworths is proud to be Aussie, through and through. It's why 96% of our fresh fruit & veg comes from our very own backyard and it's also the reason why 100% of our fresh meat comes from Australian farms and nowhere else. Welcome to Australia's Fresh Food People!
We are much more than a supermarket though, we are part of Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, and have the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands. With recent expansion into financial services and award-winning multi-channel initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian retail.
Reporting to the Portfolio Manager - Logistics, this role exists to add value by engaging internal customers and leading sourcing activities for the supply of non trade goods and services. This is done by understanding overall customer needs, developing and managing category strategies and sourcing events to reduce total costs, ensure value for money and provide high levels of service and compliance with policies, standards and best practice. In particular the role will be responsible for:
Engaging Woolworths business units to ensure alignment across compliance management, sourcing management, contract management and supplier management activities.
Assisting business stakeholders in developing the specifications for a desired product or service to meet the needs of the end users.
Developing category strategies including considerations for make vs buy, approach to inventory, insource vs outsource, go-to-market strategies and Total Cost Management
Analysing and understanding all potential risks at the category level – such as supply continuity – that can put safety, revenues or public relations image at risk and to develop appropriate mitigation strategies
Identifying strategies to develop a more competitive supply market, for example onshore vs. offshore supply sources
Accountable for managing ongoing contract variations, milestones, expirations and updates driven by business units or external environmental changes. Accountable and responsible for ensuring all contracts are centrally logged with the contract register.
About You
WOWpeople are great people. Whether we’re learning new things, seizing the initiative, or winning together our customers are at the heart of everything we do. MCIPS or tertiary qualified in Procurement, Supply Chain or Business Administration.
Extensive experience in the strategic end-to-end management of procurement categories within a large centralised procurement function.
Proven capability in managing high spend high complexity goods & services categories.
Deep understanding of total cost of ownership principles and value levers.
Must have advanced verbal, written and negotiation skills.
Be a strategic thinker and have strong commercial acumen.

Proven negotiation skills, sales management, and problem solving skills
Strong financial and commercial acumen with experience and success in setting and delivering financial budgets, margin mix and supplier funding
Creativity and a passion for product development
We can offer you:
An attractive remuneration and benefits package - including base salary, a full maintained and serviced company vehicle, staff discount, and short and long term incentive scheme
Training and development - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential
A fast-paced, dynamic, and innovative environment where you will be challenged and rewarded
An exciting career - As our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people.

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Merchandise Manager - Deli (142085)

Merchandise Manager |Work with Quality and Trusted Brands

Be part of the fresh food people where your input is recognised and changes can be achieved
Join at a time where you can build a legacy within the Deli team
Great salary plus added company benefits including modern offices in Bella Vista with parking
About Us
At Woolworths, spreading the joy of food to our customers is the reason we do what we do. We live it, we breathe it. Woolworths offers real opportunities for career development, for those who love food and putting a smile on a customer’s face.

About You
This role is responsible for developing and executing a strategy for our Deli portfolio that focuses on the customer and delivers growing and sustainable financial results. In addition you will be responsible in guiding, coaching and leading your team to be highly skilled future leaders of our Supermarkets business.
Specifically you will:
Have ownership and accountability of the total department
Deliver a customer focussed plan - short and long term planning
Lead and empower a large team
Develop and coachthe next generation of leaders
Be an Industry leader, driving innovation & change
Achieve department P and L
Be inclusive of other areas and drive aligned ways of working
To be successful you will have:
A proven track record to manage or develop product/category with sound business acumen
A history in a similar position preferably within fresh food
Experience in developing a strategy that is aligned to the overarching divisional strategy
The ability to coach and develop, lead, motivate and inspire a high performing team

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Fulfilment Manager - West Gosford Area (142063)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
Are you passionate about wine, beer and spirits and delivering world-class customer experience? If so, Dan Murphy's may be the right fit for you!
At Dan Murphy's our philosophy is simple: to provide our customers the largest range of wine, beer and spirits from both Australia and the rest of the world at prices that are guaranteed to be lower than those of any other liquor retailer.
Dan Murphy's is a leading liquor retailer and part of Australia's largest retail group, Woolworths Limited. Alongside Dan Murphy's, Woolworths Limited includes some of the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands in Australia. With recent expansion into home improvement, financial services and award-winning multi option retailing initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian Retail.
As a Customer Experience Manager, you collaborate with the store leadership team to manage a Dan Murphy's store. You provide support for team and customers alike, and deliver the overall vision and sales objectives of the business. The Customer Experience Manager is key to ensuring our brand and stories are presented with passion and enthusiasm, and that customers are provided with a world class shopping experience every time they visit our store.
Key responsibilities include:
• Collaborate with the store leadership team to efficiently manage the store
• Lead team in delivery of world class customer experience, incredible product knowledge, effective sales techniques, promotions, events and in-store theatre
• Responsible for the overall product knowledge and selling techniques activities, and coach and motivate the entire team
• Identify opportunities to improve sales and service element of the store
• Accept a high degree of responsibility and accountability for others as well as yourself
• Act as a change advocate and support new programs and initiatives that impact business performance
• Build authentic and positive connections with customers and team
• Share your passion for our Pinnacle Liquor Brands and generate excitement about new products and promotions
• Use merchandising flair to create a visually appealing in-store theatre
To be considered for this role you need to be able to meet the following selection criteria:
• Management or leadership experience with demonstrable success in leading others
• Experience in coaching, training and developing team
• Exceptional product knowledge across various liquor product categories
• A flair for in-store theatre, coordinating promotional activities and events
• A track record of developing new ways to maximise sales and business goals
• Dynamic and high performance driven by success
• A pro at delivering world-class customer experience and creating positive connections
• Initiative and demonstrate creativity in solving problems
• Energy and edge and willingness to embrace change in support of our ever-changing business
We will offer you:
• An attractive remuneration package including base salary, super, and incentive scheme
• Added benefits - including staff discount, corporate health care options, and much more.
• Training and education - we pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and offer a diverse range of learning and development experiences
• An exciting career - as our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Fixed Term Dispensing Technician - Church Corner (141983)
jobs_requirement:
Working for Countdown isn't just about in-store opportunities. We're at the cutting edge of retail innovation, and this is supported by a reputable Manufacturing, Logistics and Corporate division including Construction, Property Management, Legal, IT, Finance, HR, Customer Service, Buying and Marketing.
Countdown is a great New Zealand Company providing our customers with quality, range and value. We are built on a passion for retail, dedication and a commitment to making our customers experience more enjoyable every time. Countdown Supermarkets is seeking a self-motivated, enthusiastic and energetic person for the role of Dispensing Technician.
Role Purpose:
• To assist the charge Pharmacist with the labelling and dispensing of medicines to the final accuracy and clinical check stage.
• To provide healthcare advice and product recommendations to customers in line with great customer service principles
• To serve customers, refill and maintain Pharmacy fixtures.
• To ensure that store shelves are well stocked and the shop is clean, tidy and safe in accordance with company standards at all times.
Key responsibilities include:
• To assist customers of both the Pharmacy and the host Countdown store with their queries and product choices.
• Deliver the highest possible standards of merchandising and display within the Pharmacy area, to reflect the professional nature of the operation and enhance the customer shopping experience.
• Ensure that all Prescription only, Restricted and Pharmacy only medicines are sourced only from approved suppliers and are stored and sold only from within the registered Pharmacy area.
• To receive Pharmacy orders and check goods against delivery notes for accuracy, expiry dates and damages.
• To put stock away diligently and accurately, recognizing good stock rotation principles and adhere to Plannograms produced for Countdown Pharmacy
• Complete general Pharmacy tasks as directed by the Pharmacy Manager, Charge Pharmacist or Pharmacy Business Manager.
• Participate fully in health campaigns that are either instigated locally by the DHB or other healthcare body or approved by the GDL Rx No1 Ltd. Company Board.
• Run AutostockR routines as requested by the Pharmacy Manager
• Ensure all initiatives meet appropriate statutory and other requirements
• To complete any Assignments, Project Work or tasks as directed/ assigned by your manager.
• To ensure the promotion of safe work practises and adherence to Company Health and Safety policies and procedures. All health and safety concerns, and all accidents, must be reported to the Departmental manager who, in turn, must report the same to the Health and Safety Department.
To be considered for this role you need to be able to meet the following selection criteria:
• Registered Technician with level 5 dispensing technician accreditation
• Dispensary experience within a retail Pharmacy
• Customer Service skills
• Sales experience
• Customer Centric
• Organisation skills
• Effective Communicator and Detail Conscious
• Proactive and Self motivated
• Strong relationship building skills
• Able to work autonomously and take responsibility for own workload
• Team player
