jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Customer Experience Manager - Dan Murphy's Blacktown and Surrounding Areas (141955)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
Are you passionate about wine, beer and spirits and delivering world-class customer experience? If so, Dan Murphy's may be the right fit for you!
At Dan Murphy's our philosophy is simple: to provide our customers the largest range of wine, beer and spirits from both Australia and the rest of the world at prices that are guaranteed to be lower than those of any other liquor retailer.
Dan Murphy's is a leading liquor retailer and part of Australia's largest retail group, Woolworths Limited. Alongside Dan Murphy's, Woolworths Limited includes some of the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands in Australia. With recent expansion into home improvement, financial services and award-winning multi option retailing initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian Retail.
As a Customer Experience Manager, you collaborate with the store leadership team to manage a Dan Murphy's store. You provide support for team and customers alike, and deliver the overall vision and sales objectives of the business. The Customer Experience Manager is key to ensuring our brand and stories are presented with passion and enthusiasm, and that customers are provided with a world class shopping experience every time they visit our store.
Key responsibilities include:
• Collaborate with the store leadership team to efficiently manage the store
• Lead team in delivery of world class customer experience, incredible product knowledge, effective sales techniques, promotions, events and in-store theatre
• Responsible for the overall product knowledge and selling techniques activities, and coach and motivate the entire team
• Identify opportunities to improve sales and service element of the store
• Accept a high degree of responsibility and accountability for others as well as yourself
• Act as a change advocate and support new programs and initiatives that impact business performance
• Build authentic and positive connections with customers and team
• Share your passion for our Pinnacle Liquor Brands and generate excitement about new products and promotions
• Use merchandising flair to create a visually appealing in-store theatre
To be considered for this role you need to be able to meet the following selection criteria:
• Management or leadership experience with demonstrable success in leading others
• Experience in coaching, training and developing team
• Exceptional product knowledge across various liquor product categories
• A flair for in-store theatre, coordinating promotional activities and events
• A track record of developing new ways to maximise sales and business goals
• Dynamic and high performance driven by success
• A pro at delivering world-class customer experience and creating positive connections
• Initiative and demonstrate creativity in solving problems
• Energy and edge and willingness to embrace change in support of our ever-changing business
We will offer you:
• An attractive remuneration package including base salary, super, and incentive scheme
• Added benefits - including staff discount, corporate health care options, and much more.
• Training and education - we pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and offer a diverse range of learning and development experiences
• An exciting career - as our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

About Us
Quality and freshness doesn’t come easy, which is why we have a fantastic group of people working around the clock at Woolworths Distribution Centres to tackle the mind boggling logistical challenge of coordinating supplies from the farm-gate to supermarket shelves across the state.
Our Distribution Centres are also a critical control point in checking the quality of fresh food and placing it in the optimal conditions to protect its flavour, freshness and texture. jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Solution Architect (133506)
jobs_requirement:
About Woolworths IT team
As Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, has the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands. Woolworths IT delivers technology solutions to our organisation by providing the right innovative technology that works. Within Woolworths IT, we currently have programs of work running to implement leading edge solutions to accelerate business growth as well as change the way we work and deliver services to our internal and external customers.
Click here to learn more about technology at Woolworths.
What You’ll Do: ​
Engaging with business stakeholders to understand their main goals and present possible options in order to help refine the scope boundaries of the initiatives they wish to progress
Defining the solution architecture for projects that deliver these initiatives You will define how the various existing applications will be modified, what new applications will be deployed and how they will integrate together in order to deliver the desired business outcome
Develop solutions that are aligned to the Woolworths Enterprise Architecture Framework
Ensure that solutions are delivered as approved by development and delivery teams
Demonstrate experience and expertise in logistics / supply chain to mentor and review the development of detailed designs solutions by design teams
Provide issue resolution as the detailed design and and delivery progresses
Provide solution architecture consultancy/support to various stakeholders on an as-needed basis
Participate in the development and ongoing operation of the Woolworths Solution Architecture capability, such as technical and design standards, processes and governance
What You'll Need to Succeed:
At least five years experience as a Solution Architect for large and complex solutions involving multiple applications with project budgets in excess of $5m.
A track record of successful delivery of application focused solution architectures with strong experience in logistics / supply chain
Excellent written and verbal communication combined with effective presentation skills and ability to adapt communication style to stakeholder
The ability to interact collaboratively and negotiate positive outcomes with diverse groups - Executives, Managers, IT Teams and subject matter experts
A proven track record of delivering outcomes and actionable IT advice in response to business strategies and goals
Relevant tertiary qualifications
Consumer products, Retail or Supply Chain experience will be highly regarded
Experience with a consultancy or professional services organisation will be highly regarded
What we can offer you:
An attractive remuneration package - including base salary, super and annual bonus
Added benefits - Including staff discounts, flexibility to work from different sites, healthcare, social club and much more (Site dependent)
Tech options - Woolworths are the largest employer of Google Apps in Australia, are early adopters of Agile and have BYOD options too
Work variety - The opportunity to work on multiple brands and sizeable projects
Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and give you the opportunity to be innovative
An exciting career - As our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Refrigeration and HVAC Field Engineer NSW (141870)
jobs_requirement:
Would you like to be a part of one of Australia’s leading companies? Are you looking to progress in your career in the HVAC & R industry? Lead by example and deliver a customer service experience that is like no other. Join the journey!
Join some of the most capable, hard-working and technically skilled people in the refrigeration and air-conditioning industry to achieve success and progress the business with energy and enthusiasm.
We are a team of high performers who are driven by not just meeting our own ambitious goals, but by exceeding them. We are proud to be working for an organisation that is committed to continuous improvement, a culture of accountability, a winner’s intensity and a strong service and work ethic.
Does this sound like the kind of place where you will thrive in?
ABOUT US:
Woolworths Engineering services (WES) operating in conjunction with Retail FM, are one of the largest providers of Refrigeration and Air Conditioning services across Australia. We are continuing to grow by providing outstanding engineering and maintenance solutions to our selected customers across the nation. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, we understand that people are important to the success of our business.
ABOUT THE ROLE:
Our team has been successful over the past few years and there is an even bigger year ahead. A vacancy has been created in our team therefore we are currently recruiting a Field Engineer to join our Sydney based team.
Sitting within our Supermarkets division and reporting to the Senior Field Engineer, your primary responsibility is to ensure that Woolworths’ refrigeration assets are installed, upgraded, commissioned to specification and maintained for the lowest cost and available to sell products to customers.
In this role, the successful candidate will carry out store equipment Audits, generate appropriate reports and liaise with the construction team to formulate a construction brief that forms the basis of the project scope of works.
You will work with the incumbent refrigeration contractor for the delivery of new stores and store refurbishments. This will ensure projects are completed in accordance with the scope of works, the specifications and to Australian standards. In addition, the Field Engineer will oversee the identification, initiation and delivery of the business units’ energy and greenhouse emissions minimisation strategies and further be involved in ensuring the successful implementation of approved projects to ensure the successful realisation of these strategies.
Furthermore, the successful candidate will support the development of any tendering strategy for all refrigeration investment (design, installation, equipment procurement & maintenance) and further ensure all compliance is maintained with relevant Woolworths’ specifications and Australian Standards.
This role will be based between the Hoxton Park NSW Retail-FM head office and Woolworths Head Office in Norwest Business Park, Bella Vista.
To be successful in this role the successful candidate will have:
Demonstrated experience in the refrigeration maintenance and engineering industry, particularly Supermarket refrigeration.
Relevant tertiary qualifications in an engineering or science discipline.
Excellent understanding of engineering systems, including design, installation & maintenance.
Excellent understanding of commercial refrigeration and air conditioning.
Understanding of and sensitive to an Fast Moving Consumer Goods (FMCG) retail operation and the impact maintenance activities have on that environment.
Understanding of compliance requirements with relevant codes, Australian Standards and other statutory provisions.
Experience, ability and comfortable in dealing with senior management at all levels in a large organisation such as Woolworths.
High level user of Word, Excel, Project, PowerPoint and Google apps.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal, including consultation, negotiation and high level representational skills.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
A career with Woolworths Engineering Services (WES) will push you and challenge you, providing growth opportunities and the prospects to advance your career. You will have exposure to highly skilled people and access to a host of staff benefits including:
Attractive Remuneration Package - including base salary, super and incentive scheme.
Added Benefits - Including staff discount, tool of trade vehicle, free secure parking and corporate healthcare options.
Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential.
An exciting career - As our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
If you think you have the skills and passion to become part of our team, APPLY NOW and fill in the online application form today!
What we can offer you:
An attractive remuneration package - including base salary, super and annual bonus
Added benefits - Including staff discounts, flexibility to work from different sites, healthcare, social club and much more (Site dependent)
Tech options - Woolworths are the largest employer of Google Apps in Australia, are early adopters of Agile and have BYOD options too
Work variety - The opportunity to work on multiple brands and sizeable projects
Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and give you the opportunity to be innovative
An exciting career - As our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

Work with a team of industry leaders

Reporting to the Head of Customer Direct Delivery, this role exists to effectively organise and allocate campaign delivery resources such that campaigns are executed on time, to budget (both cost/effort & ROI / alignment to team commercial KPIs) to required quality standards. In particular the role will be responsible for:
Reviewing incoming briefs, trafficking all work in and out of the team, ensuring creative standards are met and campaigns are delivered on time, on brief and on quality.
Forecasting team capacity and high level revenue, and managing various internal stakeholders to ensure appropriate prioritisation is placed on all campaign requests.
Track the overall forward plan considering customer contact volumes/rules and high level ROI forecasts (from business cases) of upcoming campaigns.
Collaborate with, and add value to, stakeholders in both pre-planning and post campaign analysis

Tertiary qualified in relevant discipline.

Woolworths is proud to be Aussie, through and through. It's why 96% of our fresh fruit & veg comes from our very own backyard and it's also the reason why 100% of our fresh meat comes from Australian farms and nowhere else. Welcome to Australia's Fresh Food People!

jobs_requirement:
Inventory Team Manager | Woolworths
Ready for a fresh new direction? This could be your opportunity.
• Join the Fresh Food People
• Connect and give back to your community
• Market competitive package + team member benefits
About Us
At Woolworths, spreading the joy of food to our customers is the reason we do what we do. We live it, we breathe it.
Woolworths offers real opportunities for career development, for those who love food, leading developing large teams and putting a smile on a customer’s face.
So if you’re someone who leads by example and strives to be better every day, then we would love to hear from you.
As a “Fresh Food” Team Manager you will be accountable for 10-20 team members helping drive a variety of people, customer and commercial metrics across your own department, each and every week!
• Start your career with us today
• Structured learning and development
• Fast-paced, fun, fresh working environment
About You
Have you got the right ingredients to be successful? The Fresh Food People share a love of customers, team and food. From ensuring our customers are top of mind each and every day, through to driving fresh idea’s to continually improve what we do, you’ll constantly strive to be the best, delivering a world class customer experience.
As a Inventory Team Manager you’ll already know what it takes to be successful having worked in a similar type of role or environment and ready to take the next step and join the Fresh Food People. You will have held previous roles that have proudly delivered successful results in relation to people development, commercial results and achieving great customer experience.
As well as leading your team to succeed, you will set and deliver high standards in the areas of merchandising, food safety and product quality to ensure we deliver on our fresh food promise.
• 7 day availability (some weekend and evening work will be required)
• Inspire a passion for winning within your team to get customers to choose Woolworths always!
• Proudly represent The Fresh Food People in your local community
We’re social! - connect with us at #WOWcareers through LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram or via www.wowcareers.com.au
Sound like your next opportunity? Apply now or head along to www.wowcareers.com.au to discover more!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Digital Marketing Coordinator (140664)
jobs_requirement:
Founded in 1924, Woolworths is Australia’s largest retailer with more than 3,000 stores across Australia and New Zealand that span food, liquor, petrol, general merchandise, home improvement and hotels. Woolworths is a proud, home-grown Australian business, employer of more than 195,000 people and committed business partner of many thousand local farmers, producers and manufacturers. Woolworths Limited manages some of Australia’s most recognized and trusted brands including Woolworths, Caltex Woolworths, Countdown, Dan Murphy’s, BWS, Langtons, Cellarmasters, Big W, Masters, ALH and EziBuy. We endeavour to create a world class experience for customers across all of our stores and platforms.
With FY14 revenues of $60.8 billion, strong performance from our core food and liquor operations is driving continued earnings and profit growth. Future growth will also come via the growth of multi-option shopping for customers as well as new ventures. Woolworths remains well positioned in its market segments and has a strong and sustainable business model.
As Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, and have the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands. With recent expansion into home improvement, financial services and award-winning multi-channel initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian retail.
For more information, visit http://www.woolworthslimited.com.au/
Role Summary
Work at the heart of a thriving business within Australia’s largest and reputable consumer products brand. Association of Woolworths Employees (AWE) at Woolworths is based on entrepreneurial spirit, outstanding products and brand reputation. AWE provides a social club to in excess of 200,000 Woolworth’s employees that reflects their needs.
We are the club of choice for our employees and our primary engagement channel which is the website, is expecting to provide a significant increase in growth over the next 18 months. The launch of a new brand combined with varying improvements to technology will support our business in taking the leap towards a digital innovative offering. The division is currently underway with a complex business transformation program that will see, people, process and technology improvements delivering business benefits by July 2016.
Role Purpose
As the AWE Digital Marketing Coordinator you will develop and plan the direction of all marketing activity on an AWE campaign. You will use your creativity and expertise to think of new ways of delivering messages to members. You will be accountable for number motivating people in the AWE team to make sure that each campaign is successful.
You will be accountable for all marketing strategies and budget including:
Supporting and developing branding
Developing and coordinating events
Managing social media
Content and user experience on existing e-commerce website
Insights reporting from CRM, Marketing and Google Analytics platforms
Development of the marketing team
Role Responsibilities
Managing commercial and strategic partnerships with external suppliers
Managing team members including– Marketing Assistant
Researching and analysing market insights via existing CRM, Google Analytics (SEO and Paid Search), Call Tracking, Customer Survey (NPS)
Identifying target markets and how best to reach members through adopting better online strategies
Developing marketing strategy in line with the overall Business Plan
Coordinating refinements to the existing website via developer resource
Planning campaigns and managing marketing budgets
Designing and applying social media, SEO strategies
Managing pipeline and delivery of AWE trade shows, conferences and sales meetings
Making sure that campaigns run to deadline and on budget
Monitoring and reporting on the effectiveness of strategies and campaigns
Managing stock ordering and product/event sales based on demand determined by data insights
Assessing improvements to current processes within the marketing department to reduce complexity and duplication of work
Key Selection Criteria
Brand management and delivery
B2C experience within a retail environment
E-commerce Web Design, EDM and copy + content writing
Strong communication skills
Exceptional written communication and presentation skills
Direct Marketing, Market Segmentation, Marketing Research, Coordination, Project Management, Reporting Research Results
Understanding the Customer Engagement, Process Improvement, Initiative, Planning, Financial Skills, Sock Controls
Proficiency with Google Analytics reporting
Experience using CMS administration (ideally Magento platform)
Desirable:
Degree qualified in Marketing, Events Management or Business Management
Efficient use of Google Aps, CRM systems
Rewards program or events background
POS system experience
CRM system / user experience e.g. Salesforce CRM, Salesforce, MS CRM.
Proficiency with My Emma or equivalent customer engagement system
Understanding of call tracking systems and performance based advertising
Sound like your next opportunity? Apply now or head along to www.wowcareers.com.au to discover more!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Category Manager / Merchandise Planner (139939)
jobs_requirement:
Merchandise planner hybrid role - General Merchandise |A fresh new direction
Do you want flexibility in your role? A rare opportunity to john the General Merchandising team in a position unlike most.... Merchandise planning / Category management, use your experience in buying for FMCG and work with our teams to make a difference - HUGE chance to work on projects across the whole of Woolworths. Combine your knowledge with analytics and your ability to communicate with all of our business
Australia’s largest retailer
Work across multiple stakeholders to implement changes and see the growth
Attractive package with added benefits such as parking, healthcare options and staff discount
About Us
At Woolworths, spreading the joy of food to our customers is the reason we do what we do. We live it, we breathe it.
Woolworths offers real opportunities for career development, for those who love food and putting a smile on a customer’s face.
So if you’re someone who leads by example and strives to be better every day, then we would love to hear from you.
Merchandise Planning has been introduced over the last two years, this role gives you the opportunity to take this onto the next stage; recommended and bring further improvements to support sales and profit targets by driving departmental analysis on sales, profit and margin to ensure budgets are met and profitable growth achieved whilst working with the events, replenishment and the buying team to deliver monthly, quarterly and annual forecasts ensuring each department delivers to budget, identifying opportunities and risks.
Report into the Merchandising manager for General Merchandise
Lead a team of three merchandise planners across the General Merchandise team including coaching and development
Contribute to the broader General Merchandise strategy
About You
WOWpeople are great people. Whether we’re learning new things, seizing the initiative, or winning together our customers are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re the sort of individual who takes accountability and strives to always do the right thing for each other, our communities, our customers, and our business then we ought to connect.
Merchandise planning experience and great commercial instinct
Proven ability to manage and bring change positively to a broad number of stakeholders
The ability to set up new ways of working and processes in a simple and efficient way
Great coaching and team leadership skills
Strong analytical skills and ability to see trends and patterns quickly
History of getting results in the buying and merchandising space

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Metro Store Planner | Pick the Best (138109)
jobs_requirement:
Metro Store Planner | Pick the Best
Your designs will create an amazing experience for our Metro Stores customers
Dynamic, market leading organisation
An attractive remuneration package
Added benefits - including staff discount, corporate healthcare and banking options
About Us
At Woolworths, spreading the joy of food to our customers is the reason we do what we do. We live it, we breathe it.
Woolworths offers real opportunities for career development, for those who love food and putting a smile on a customer’s face.
So if you’re someone who leads by example and strives to be better every day, then we would love to hear from you.
New CEO, revitalised strategy, exciting transformation
Training and education - we pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential
An exciting career - as our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
About You
WOWpeople are great people. Whether we’re learning new things, seizing the initiative, or winning together our customers are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re the sort of individual who takes accountability and strives to always do the right thing for each other, our communities, our customers, and our business then we ought to connect.
The Store Planning team are behind the customer experience and touchpoints in-store, exceeding customer expectations at every opportunity and are involved in developing highly commercial, creative design and merchandising solutions together with integrated Point of Sale and small interior projects for Woolworths Supermarkets.
About your new role
A key member of the Store Planning Team, you will develop Metro Store concepts, plan & document stores in consultation with the Metro Planning Manager and will communicate ideas and concepts through clear and effective methods using 2D and Revit design and through the effective use of software or freehand sketching.
You will manage allocated store plans, taking projects from concept to full documentation. To deliver each project you will work closely with stakeholders, develop an appropriate scope of works having regard to concept and budget, detail plan/document that scope, & present the plan back to stakeholders for approval.
You will naturally be a great communicator, managing stakeholder expectations and relationships to develop & document great store plans & positive outcomes. You have strong drive and enthusiasm, taking initiative and working collaboratively. Hopefully you're also passionate about retail or willing to open your mind to the possibilities in this space.
You'll have proven experience successfully managing multiple design projects from concept to completion.
Undergraduate degree in Architectural Design or similar
Conceptual Design using 2D software packages and Revit design
Strong experience/capability to develop & document technical plans using Revit
Current driver's licence as travel to stores and sites will be required

jobs_requirement:
Store Manager | Fuel

Operating since 1996, Woolworths Fuel is growing fast offering pay point and convenience sites to our customers nationally. We are much more than a Fuel retailer though, we are part of Woolworths Limited which is made up of the most recognisable and trusted brands in retailing.
Our expertise stretches across food, liquor, fuel, general merchandise, financial services and home improvement and we're building on that foundation to diversify into new areas.
As a Store Manager you will be dedicated to making your store shine. You will be accountable for maximising sales, profit and growth each and every week!

About You
Woolworths people are great people. Whether we’re learning new things, seizing the initiative, or winning together our customers are at the heart of everything we do.
If you’re the sort of individual who takes accountability and strives to always do the right thing for each other, our communities, our customers, and our business then we ought to connect.
As a Store Manager your positive attitude and a desire to go above and beyond will see you thrive in our fast paced retail environment.
Your passion for customer service will enhance their overall experience. Your exceptional multi-tasking abilities and observation skills will enable you to be responsible for the safety and security of the site.
You will lead your team to deliver exceptional customer service, providing training and development of team members in sales, service and safety.

• Experience in developing staff and motivating teams

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Store Manager - Woolworths Taree (141315)
jobs_requirement:
Store Manager | Woolworths
Are you ready to share the joy of food and provide great customer service to Australia? Do you want to be at the core of the community in which you serve? Do you get satisfaction out of seeing your team achieve their career goals?
• Be a part of Australia’s largest retail group
• Create a customer centred culture to change the face of Australian retail
• Immerse yourself within a unique culture that is down to earth yet dynamic in a rapidly changing environment
About Us
At Woolworths, spreading the joy of food to our customers is the reason we do what we do. We live it, we breathe it.
Woolworths offers real opportunities for career development, for those who love food, leading developing large teams and putting a smile on a customer’s face.
So if you’re someone who leads by example and strives to be better every day, then we would love to hear from you.
As a Store Manager you will be dedicated to making your store shine. You will be accountable for maximising sales, profit and growth each and every week. Your leadership and engagement will create a great place to work where team members optimise their potential and deliver back to our customers.
As a Store Manager you will:
• Be responsible for making your store shine
• Have an ability to work in an evolving, fast paced, fluid team environment
• Provide clear goals and a great place to work and grow for your team
• Create a clear vision and direction to deliver on business strategies and priorities
About You
Have you got the right ingredients to be successful? The Fresh Food People share a love of customers, team and food. From ensuring our customers are top of mind each and every day, through to driving fresh idea’s to continually improve what we do, you’ll constantly strive to be the best, delivering a world class customer experience.
As a Store Manager you will lead by example and strive to excel every day. You will deliver results through your ability to influence stakeholders and build lasting relationships within the business. Your self motivation, eye for detail, capacity to prioritise workload, along with your ability to problem solve and adapt to change will enable you to meet deadlines and deliver world class customer service.
• Demonstrate a strong customer focus
• Have solid experience and success in managing budgets and maximising profits
• Demonstrate ability in stock management, merchandising and shrinkage prevention processes
• Lead a large and diverse team that is representative of the community in which you serve
We’re social! - connect with us at #WOWcareers through LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram or via www.wowcareers.com.au

Evaluating and reviewing long term and short term replenishment planning for effectiveness balancing availability, inventory and cost

Ability to lead and motivate a high performing team
Proven experience in performance management through goal setting, creation of KPI’s, monitoring and surveillance activities
Superior relationship management in building rapport with peers/stakeholders of all levels and resolving conflict to support the team in achieving its targets
Demonstrated experience in Business Planning and Management, including a deep understating of metrics and KPI’s
Complex problem solving ability to identify process issues and conduct root cause analysis to develop contingencies/countermeasures to resolve issues

jobs_requirement:

About Us:

You will have the opportunity to work across a very dynamic team engaging with talented and passionate teams, gaining exposure to the inner workings of a huge and complex project.

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Dispatch Team Leader - Woolworths Meat Company Truganina (140005)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
Australia’s biggest retailer, Woolworths Limited, has partnered with UK based Hilton Food Group to enhance our meat offer to our customers.
The joint venture will deliver significant investment in manufacturing techniques new to the Australian market as well as creating new jobs in our Company.
Woolworths is built on a passion for retail, dedication and a commitment to making our customers experience more enjoyable every time. Woolworths is proudly Australian and supportive of Australian products. It's why 100% of our fresh meat comes from Australian farms.
This role is based at our new Truganina Meat processing facility and reports to the Logistics Manager for Woolworths Meat Company. This successful applicant will need to have a flexible availability as this role is inclusive of weekends.
About the Role
As Dsspatch Team Leader , you will lead and manage the assigned Dispatch teams to meet safety, operations, people, customer and financial performance expectations.
To work closely with the Logistics support team to ensure all products are delivered to our customers on time and in full, and doing so with safely being the key priority.
Further to this, to gain a thorough knowledge of the plant operations as it applies to Logistics.
You will also be directed and supported by the Logistics Support Team in dealing with staff, internal / external customer issues and complaints as they may arise within the Dept..
Key Responsibilities
Supervise the performance of assigned despatch team to meet loading times and delivery windows and ensure adherence to standard operating procedures
Build and promote a team environment focused on working collaboratively to achieve team and DC objectives
Lead, motivate and engage despatch team members by applying effective people management processes and practices
Conduct staff assessments of competence against standard operating procedure (SOP) criteria
Complete all required administrative tasks associated with managing the despatch team in an accurate and timely manner
Ensure housekeeping and safe working practices are adhered to,
Develop and Promote safety policies and procedures on an on-going basis
Use effective communication techniques which encourage open and honest communications and constant information flow. (2 Way)
Strong focus on the continuous improvement of systems and processes
Understand and adhere to all relevant Company Policies and Procedures and to promote same amongst team
Respond to incidents and problems in a timely and accurate manner.
Day to day liaison with the Logistics Support team to ensure operations are effectively managed and monitored.
Ensure all relevant shift paperwork has been completed within a timely manner .
.
You Will Have
Minimum 2 Yrs experience in Logistics / DC Warehouse in a leadership capacity is preferred.
Experience in WMS / Inventory Systems. SAP knowledge within an automated environment would be advantageous.
Personal Attributes Required:
Advanced communication (both written and verbal)
Ability to prioritise and delegate tasks accordingly
Think ahead and anticipate problems, issues and solutions
Willingness and flexibility to train in supporting Logistics functions, when required.
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Refrigeration Service Technician ( HVAC+R Mechanics) - Afternoon Shift (120944)
jobs_requirement:
Join some of the most capable, hard-working and technically skilled people in the refrigeration and air-conditioning industry to achieve success and progress the business with energy and enthusiasm.
We are a new team of top performers who are driven by not just meeting our own ambitious goals, but by exceeding them. We are proud to be working for an organisation that is committed to continuous improvement, a culture of accountability, a winner’s intensity and a strong service ethic.
Does this sound like the kind of place where you will thrive in?
ABOUT US:
Retail FM is one of the largest providers of Refrigeration and Air Conditioning services in Australia. We are continuing to grow by providing outstanding engineering and maintenance solutions to our selected customers across the nation. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, we understand that people are important to the success of our business
About the role:
We are currently seeking an experienced Service Technician - Sydney on a permanent basis to work an afternoon shift (5:00pm -1:00am). Reporting to the Service Supervisor your primary responsibility is to achieve productivity levels as per agreed customer-generated reactive calls to be closed per day and to complete allocated planned maintenance activities (air conditioning and pre-summer).
In this role, you will:
Proactively look for potential sources of refrigerant gas leaks in order to reduce refrigerant usage
Reduce average reactive call volume per store/month below agreed target
Control and reduce costs (labour, materials, sub contractors) against store budget
Ensure refrigeration case uptime to maximise sales for customer
Achieve service response times as per business rules
Achieve first time fix targets
Meet energy saving targets as agreed with key stakeholders
Maintain and update Asset registers
To be considered for this role you should have the following:
Trade qualification – minimum of Certificate III in Refrigeration and Air Conditioning or equivalent
Restricted Electrical Workers License (where required by state legislation)
Current, valid ArcTick Refrigerant Handling Licence
Current, valid Motor Vehicle Drivers Licence
A minimum of two (2) years’ post apprenticeship experience in a similar role within the commercial refrigeration service and installation industry, preferably with commercial supermarket experience
Strong technical and operational skills with a sound understanding of commercial / supermarkets refrigeration and air conditioning systems and equipment
Well developed verbal and written communication skills
Strong interpersonal and customer service skills
High attention to detail
Effective time management and organisational skills
Ability to work autonomously
Ability to work under pressure to set deadlines without compromise to quality or service

About Us
Quality and freshness doesn’t come easy, which is why we have a fantastic group of people working around the clock at Woolworths Distribution Centres to tackle the mind boggling logistical challenge of coordinating supplies from the farm-gate to supermarket shelves across the state.
Our Distribution Centres are also a critical control point in checking the quality of fresh food and placing it in the optimal conditions to protect its flavour, freshness and texture. Alongside the top service we provide to our supermarkets we also have super performance in our Distribution Network which store stock for many of our other brands such as BWS, Dan Murphy’s, Big W, Masters Home Improvement to mention just a few.
The role of a store person plays an integral role in ensuring that the right stock gets to the right store at the right time for our customers, Logistics is constantly changing to meet business demands. The position requires a strong sense of team work to ensure that the goods are dispatched in a timely manner.

• Picking orders accurately and in a timely manner
• Assembling and packaging stock appropriately for dispatch
• Operating industrial equipment in accordance to Occupational Health and Safety requirements
• Housekeeping
• Despatch and receiving as required by operation and business needs

• A passion for providing the best customer service experience

• Ability to be able to work a flexible roster

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: FINANCIAL ACCOUNTANT (140458)
jobs_requirement:
Would you like to be a part of one of Australia's leading companies? Are you looking to progress in your accounting and finance career? Lead by example and deliver a customer service experience that is like no other. Join the journey!
We are a team who are driven by not just meeting our own ambitious goals, but by exceeding them. We are proud to be working for an organisation that is committed to continuous improvement, a culture of accountability, a winner's intensity and a strong service ethic.
Does this sound like the kind of place where you will thrive in?
ABOUT US:
Retail FM is one of the largest providers of Refrigeration and Air Conditioning services in Australia. We are continuing to grow by providing outstanding engineering and maintenance solutions to our selected customers across the nation. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, we understand that people are important to the success of our business.
ABOUT THE ROLE:
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Financial Accountant to join our finance team located in Hoxton Park. Reporting to a supportive Financial Controller and working within a close knit team that prides its self on its culture, team-work and customer service; you will assist with day-to-day finance operations, general accounting duties and preparing balance sheet reconciliations for Retail FM.
This role would suit a highly motivated individual who is looking to develop and build on their existing finance skills while building key stakeholder relationships across the business, offering mentoring and support to the rest of the finance team and ensuring that the financial performance and position for the business is accurately represented in the ERP system.
Other responsibilities include but not limited to:
Assisting with statutory lodgments including BAS, FBT and Payroll Tax Returns
Interacting effectively with customers and staff and contribute to the development and implementation of company procedures
Ensuring all facets of General Ledger accounting work is completed accurately and in a timely fashion.
Preparing Month-End Reports and Variance Analysis
Reviewing of all balance sheets accounts, investigate and clear any unreconciled items, and highlight any risks to the Finance Controller.
The investment in your career along with the training and support offered will see you presented with endless opportunities to progress within not only with Retail FM but also the wider Woolworths Group.
To be successful in this role the successful candidate will have:
Formal qualifications in finance or accounting, including, or studying towards CA/CPA
Excel, Word and Powerpoint skills
Solid troubleshooting and problem solving skills
A sound knowledge of financial and business principles.
Excellent verbal and written skills
Strong interpersonal and presentation skills and have the ability to work in a calm and logical manner while at times under pressure to meet customer and company needs
It is not essential but desirable that the successful candidate has:
Proficiency with a recognised ERP accounting system (ie, Pronto or similar).
Experience in managing and/or mentoring staff
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
A career with Retail FM will push you and challenge you, providing growth opportunities and the prospects to advance your career. You will have exposure to highly skilled people and access to a host of staff benefits including:
An attractive remuneration package
Ongoing training and development opportunities
Staff discount card
If you think you have the skills and passion to become part of our team, APPLY NOW and fill in the online application form today!
Are you an industry specialist looking for your next career move?
Why not make it with the newest member to the Woolworths Limited family, Retail FM.

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Buyer Hardgoods - Chocolate, Confectionary & Drinks (140248)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
BIG W is a modern, Australian Discount Department Store. WIth a heritage dating back to 1964 and now 186 stores across Australia we are proud of of our 52 year history. We are all about offering our customers choice, by designing products in-house that our customers want but by also offering them national and international brands that they know and trust.
What we're like
One of the most critical elements to our success is our people, having an empowered and high performing team of people that love what they do. BIG W people are passionate, humble and relentlessly curious about all things retail. Everything we do is to provide our customers with warm service and great value products and services.
Role Purpose
We have opportunities to work within the categories of Chocolate, confectionery, drinks and Beauty, baby, Hygiene to build and buy the best range, at the best cost/deal. Price the range to maximise sales, profit and customer satisfaction and optimise inventory.
This is an exciting time to join our business we are entering a period of turnaround and have assembled an inspirational and highly experienced senior leadership team.
Main Accountabilities
Conduct research in order to gain a thorough understanding of the target markets and external market drivers (including talking to suppliers, monitoring exchange rate, economic forces & competitors)
Build range, pricing and channel plan in line with option plan, using insights and aligned to BIG W strategies
Buy the range in line with option plan and OTB and on the critical path schedule
Own supplier relationships and optimise supplier portfolio in category, joint business planning and negotiate trading terms with suppliers, ensuring the financial targets are met, partnering with BIGW Asia to maximise own brand offer within category.
Partner with Graphic Design Team on Own Brand product packaging design
Identify commercial promotional events and present to marketing (including ROI) so Marketing can establish best marketing campaign activity, ensuring promotions are appropriate creatively as well as commercial
Work closely with Marketing, Planning and Stores on the execution of promotions and events
Work closely with Planograms to optimise visual presentation of range
Analyse in-season and post-season performance. Remain very responsive to sales opportunities to move stock. Use pricing and markdowns deliver on strategy
Core Career Experiences and Behaviours
Previous experience as a commercial retail buyer
Strong negotiation and supplier management skills.
Managed a large portfolio with end to end influence on product, price, promotion and quality.
Product development & sourcing.
Sound like your next opportunity? Apply now or head along to www.wowcareers.com.au to discover more!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Systems Manager (128097)
jobs_requirement:
About Woolworths IT team
As Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, has the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands. Woolworths IT delivers technology solutions to our organisation by providing the right innovative technology that works. Within Woolworths IT, we currently have programs of work running to implement leading edge solutions to accelerate business growth as well as change the way we work and deliver services to our internal and external customers.
Click here to learn more about technology at Woolworths.
About The Role:
The System Manager requirement is in relation with end to end application lifecycle management for Replenishment systems including project delivery, system enhancements & BAU support including incident and problement management as well as management of continuous service improvements.
We are looking for an experienced Product Manager with strong technology focus and solid exposure to retail who could demonstate application ownership for the suite of replenishment products including home grown Replenishment Central (RC) as well as a suite of JDA products including legacy products such as Replenishment Planner (RP), Demand Manager (DM) as well as new products such as Fulfilment and Demand across different banners within Woolworths.
The technology focus includes - J2EE & Informatica running on Oracle Exadata platform. Experience in SAP and Reporting products will also be beneficial.
What You'll Do:
End-to-end application ownership
Accountable for the performance of the overall product portfolio
Participation in project delivery to ensure a robust solution is being delivered
Manage transition of projects (including large transformational projects) into BAU state
Change management - Review and approval of technical changes
People mangement - reporting lines include DevOPs and L3 support teams
Vendor Management - Establish relationship with our strategic partners
Stakeholder Management - incuding senior stakeholders at “Head of” and GM level
Risk Management including being proactive in understanding, highlighting & mitigating the issues
Ability to contribute towards the future roadmap of the products
Ability to determine the growth pattern of the organisation and drive the enhancements to the products
What You'll Need to Succeed:
Solid Product Management experience
Experience in people management skills including coaching and mentoring
Experience in Retail, Supply Chain, Logistics or Replenishment will be highly regarded
Excellent in Communication and Stakeholder management skills
Experience in managing technology and product vendors and work effectively in a multi cultural environment
Good understanding of technology including J2EE, ETL, Databases and In-Memory applications (Exadata)
Understanding of Supply chain products including JDA products such as Fulfilment and Demand will be highly desirable
Good understanding of Infrastructure including Superdomes, Storage & Firewalls
Ability to manage conflicts and achieve positive outcome
What we can offer you:
An attractive remuneration package - including base salary, super and annual bonus
Added benefits - Including staff discounts, flexibility to work from different sites, healthcare, social club and much more (Site dependent)
Tech options - Woolworths are the largest employer of Google Apps in Australia, are early adopters of Agile and have BYOD options too
Work variety - The opportunity to work on multiple brands and sizeable projects
Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and give you the opportunity to be innovative
An exciting career - As our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: National Transport & Optimization Manager (131420)
jobs_requirement:
Working for Countdown isn't just about in-store opportunities. We're at the cutting edge of retail innovation, and this is supported by a reputable Manufacturing, Logistics and Corporate division including Construction, Property Management, Legal, IT, Finance, HR, Customer Service, Buying and Marketing.
Logistics is at the heart of Countdown and key to the success of our business. As a Senior member of the Logistics team, you’ll play an integral part of one of New Zealand’s largest and most exciting supply chain networks. With limitless development opportunities, access to the latest technology and the chance to work with the nation’s biggest Supermarket, your career with Countdown could take you anywhere.
It’s rewarding work and that’s why we’re always on the lookout for talented, innovative and dedicated people to help us achieve our vision to be the best at moving products, so customers always choose Countdown.
You will play strategic leadership role delivering process improvements that deliver results for our customer experience and creates strategic advantage for Countdown. Your ability to evaluate on-going opportunities to improve service across our networks in a timely and cost effective manner at a National level is a key part of this role and imperative to the collaboration of all our distribution centres through-out the country.
You will:
Identify and implement changes to Transport networks with a focus on ensuring the Countdown transport networks are integrated where possible and optimum equipment is used for all tasks including order frequency and size.
Work with carriers to identify the most efficient transport equipment and mode to reduce cost with a key focus on safety & service while ensuring high transport service level to stores and to the distribution centre
Effectively communicate to stores, retail operations, transport providers, support office and logistics in regards to transportation of product to stores.
Identify and/or develop opportunities across the total Logistics division to improve efficiencies and service and then work with relevant stakeholders to drive change
Work collaboratively across Countdown to identify, lead and facilitate process and continuous improvement initiatives in order to achieve the Business Strategy
Accelerate business performance through building a mind-set of, and capability for Business Excellence
Lead the prioritisation of process improvement and Business Optimisation initiatives across Transport based on customer insights and performance metrics
We are looking for someone with the following attributes and skills:
Have a high level of current experience in management of a distribution centre or FMCG environment which is of similar complexity and scale and be seen as a deep functional and business process improvement expert
Experience in transport management with detailed cost management
Have a proven ability of driving continuous improvement, with the ability to engage and develop staff
Proven background in implementing and driving change
Results focused with a vision for on-going improvement
Strong influencer and communicator: skilled at presenting to at executive level
Passionate about compliance, quality assurance and finding out of the box solutions
Ability to work with and influence multiple stakeholders to deliver improved end to end outcomes
Strong business acumen and experience managing multiple stakeholders within a complex organisation
Demonstrated track record leading high performing teams to achieve challenging objectives
As the successful candidate, you have built up significant experience across Supply Chain, Logistics and Distribution, and have a strong foundation of strategic leadership principles.

jobs_requirement:

• Advanced problem solving skills
• Working Knowledge of retail supply chains
• Understanding of stores retail operations
• Proven experience in challenging the status quo to achieve the best outcome for the business and driving continuous improvement
• Technical Knowledge - statistical forecasting and its applications to inventory management or recent graduate with economic / finance / business qualification'(s)
We Will Offer You

Adept at planning and problem solving with the ability to prioritise and manage multiple tasks
Excellent negotiation skills with the ability to deal with key stakeholders
Customer focussed and a creative thinker
Strong Excel and systems experience.

● Implement processes to enable the team to deliver on the customer service model
● Proactively explore continuous improvement opportunities across the Accounts Receivable and Banking Reconciliation functions
● Manage a processing team of approximately 45 team members
To be considered for this role you should have the following:
● Experience in managing high performance teams
● Formal qualification(s) in a commerce or general management discipline (Desirable)
● Managing teams within a culture of continuous improvement
● Proven ability to develop, engage, motivate and inspire teams
● Be motivated and driven by successful outcomes and deadlines
● Experience in managing departmental risks, balanced with process efficiency
● Strong practical knowledge and experience in ERP financial systems and processes
● Finance management experience, gained through 10+ years practical experience
● Experience in a large organisation and in a shared services environment
What we can offer you:
● Attractive Remuneration Package - including base salary, super and incentive scheme.
● Added Benefits - Including staff discount, free secure parking, corporate healthcare options.
● Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential.
● An exciting career - As our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Category Manager - Corporate Services (128426)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
As Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, has the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands. With recent expansion into home improvement, financial services and award-winning multi-channel initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian retail.
Company Context
Founded in 1924, Woolworths is Australia’s largest retailer with more than 3,500 stores across Australia and New Zealand that span food, liquor, petrol, general merchandise, home improvement and hotels. Woolworths is a proud, home-grown Australian business, employer of more than 200,000 people and committed business partner of many thousand local farmers, producers and manufacturers. Woolworths Limited manages some of Australia’s most recognized and trusted brands including Woolworths, Caltex Woolworths, Countdown, Dan Murphy’s, BWS, Langtons, Cellarmasters, Big W, Masters, ALH and EziBuy. We endeavour to create a world class experience for customers across all of our stores and platforms. With 2014 revenues of $60 billion, strong performance from our core food and liquor operations is driving continued earnings and profit growth. Future growth will also come via the growth of multi-option shopping for customers as well as new ventures. Woolworths remains well positioned in its market segments and has a strong and sustainable business
model.
About Us
It's the beginning of a new era for the Woolworths’ Group Commercial team. We are an enterprise wide function and our job is to provide thought leadership, best practise advice and deliver a service that adds value to our business partners.
We operate in a fast paced, nimble environment with entrepreneurial-minded professionals who work collaboratively to build relationships to achieve outcomes to be the leaders in the market. Our point of difference is that we are part of Australia’s largest retailer allowing us to provide unparalleled career opportunities. The team is positioned to drive change and continuous improvement across the business whilst continually focussed on
providing excellent customer experiences to key stakeholders. The Group Commercial operating model ensures that we are a high performing team providing the best service to our customers.
Role Summary
The purpose of this role is to: -
Add value by engaging internal customers and leading sourcing activities for the supply of non-trade goods and services enterprise-wide. This is done by understanding overall customer needs, developing and managing category strategies and sourcing events to reduce total costs, ensure value for money and provide high levels of service and compliance with policies, standards and best practice. This may include direct quantifiable EBITDA, Working Capital and Cost Avoidance benefits through improved commercial terms and reduction of complexity in processes and systems involved in securing non trade related goods and services. Responsible for managing relationships with key supply partners to ensure that Woolworths’effectively leverages its overall purchasing power and to ensure that maximum value is extracted over the contract term, by ensuring that negotiated agreements are implemented in full and that benefits identified at the start of the contract term are secured through compliance management.
Location of Role
This position will be located in the Company’s Norwest Support Office in Bella Vista Sydney.
Want to connect? Connect with me on LinkedIn Dean Willett. We’re also social! - connect with us at #WOWcareers through LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram or via www.wowcareers.com.au #LI
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Productivity Improvement Analyst (128016)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
Woolworths is proud to be Aussie, through and through. It's why 96% of our fresh fruit & veg comes from our very own backyard and it's also the reason why 100% of our fresh meat comes from Australian farms and nowhere else. Welcome to Australia's Fresh Food People!
We are much more than a supermarket though, we are part of Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, and have the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands. With recent expansion into home improvement, financial services and award-winning multi-channel initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian retail.
About the opportunity
We currently have a permanent opportunity for a Senior Productivity Improvement Analyst within our Productivity Team.
Reporting to the National Workforce Productivity Manager, you will provide key inputs into the continuous improvement of business processes, produce plans that will realise opportunities for business and productivity improvement and support development of direct wages targets based on engineered standards that reflect business expectations.
This position is based at our support office in Norwest Business Park, Bella Vista.
In this role, you will:
Conduct work measurement studies, including data collection and analysis
Conduct process mapping, with input to standard operating procedure and process improvement
Conduct benchmarking performance and propose staffing efficiencies
Complete labour modelling to identify and validate process and productivity improvements
Assist in increase labour performance; develop recommendations and initiatives that generate long-term sustainable change
Perform work measurement to develop engineered standards that enable store specific staffing targets
Become trained and skilled in work measurement - MOST
Build and deliver simple tools and processes into stores to enable simple and effective control of wages, hours and overall productivity
Investigate, analyse and report on productivity issues / opportunities
Lead and own the end to end of the diagnostics and reviews
To be considered for this role you should have the following:
Degree qualified in Engineering (Industrial/systems preferred)
Good analytical, presentation, planning and organisational skills
Ideally you will have knowledge of Six-Sigma or Lean methodologies
Considerable skills in networking and influencing
Positive and confident manner with ability to confront and challenge resistance and issues
Change management experience preferred
High level communication skills with ability to influence and build rapport at all levels
Advanced skills in MS Office
What we can offer you:
Attractive Remuneration Package - including base salary, super and incentive scheme
Added Benefits including staff discount, free secure parking, corporate healthcare options, fitness centre, onsite supermarket and a choice of in-house cafes
Training and Education - we pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential.
An exciting career - as our business grows so do the opportunities for our people
Want to connect? Connect with me on LinkedIn Joel Keune We’re also social! - connect with us at #WOWcareers through LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram or via www.wowcareers.com.au
#LI
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!

jobs_title: Career Opportunities: Business Support Advisor HR Systems (125855)
jobs_requirement:
About Us
As Australia's biggest retail group, Woolworths Limited, has the most trusted food, liquor and general merchandise brands. With recent expansion into financial services and award-winning multi-channel initiatives, our innovation and customer obsession is changing the face of Australian retail.
As a business we never stand still, we are always innovating and adapting to meet the needs of our customers and our people. We have been working hard to ensure that as an internal Woolworths HR Function we add value to our business as well as provide efficient and effective services to employees and line managers.
The purpose of the role is to support the Process & Systems Optimisations Manager in implementing initiatives associated with the ongoing maintenance, development and improvement of Woolworths HR systems. This role will work closely with other members of our HR Process & Systems teams to ensure continuous improvement through the HR Operating Model, change management and support with IT. Business Support Advisors will act as a tier two escalation point for system-related issues
Technology is an integral part of our work and home lives.
At work, we expect our technology to be as cool as what we use for personal use.
Our SAP SuccessFactors Human Capital Management solutions integrates staff onboarding, social business and collaboration tools, a learning management system, performance management, recruiting software, applicant tracking software, succession planning, talent management and HR analytics to deliver business strategy alignment, team execution and maximize people performance.
This position is based at our Shared Services Centre in Eight Mile Plains.
Key Responsibilities
Participate in the coordination of system upgrades and regression testing
Focus on the implementation of system optimisation to increase efficiencies across existing HR processes
Focus on continuous improvement of HR modules based on feedback from the business in order to enhance the user experience
Management of Tier 2 resolution processes using Woolworths Customer Relationship Management systems (Salesforce)
Develop user training plans to ensure new system enhancements are quickly adopted and sustained including the development of supporting training materials
Monitor and provide recommendations on the capabilities of the HR systems as per the Success Factors release strategy to ensure stability and continuous improvement
Participate in and contribute to relevant internal governance and external user forums.
Career Experiences
Previous experience in Success Factors
Experience in working with highly integrated systems
Strong understanding of HR and payroll systems
Results oriented and ability to work to tight time frames
WOWpeople are great people. Whether we’re learning new things, seizing the initiative, or winning together our customers are at the heart of everything we do. If you’re the sort of individual who takes accountability and strives to always do the right thing for each other, our communities, our customers, and our business then we want to hear from you.
What We’ll Offer You
An attractive remuneration package - including base salary, super and incentive scheme
Tech options - Woolworths are the largest employer of Google Apps in Australia
Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential
An exciting career - as our business grows, so do the opportunities for our people
If you have the energy, edge and ideas that will shape the future of our business for years to come then we want to hear from you!
